Column.value: <Script Name="SID -Create ABE Dia (4x4)" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
'create a nested hierarchy of ABEs starting from a package.
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim thePackage as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
select case treeSelectedType case otPackage set thePackage = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList ' for each element in thePackage.Elements ' for each subElement in element.Elements ' if element.MetaType = "ABE" then CreateNestedHierarchyDiagram thePackage, levelList, "ABE", false '''params: parentItem, levelList, diagramType, openDiagram ' end if ' next ' next case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK end select end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript
sub Test(packageGUID)
dim aPackage As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) set aPackage = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList CreateNestedHierarchyDiagram aPackage, "ABE", levelList
end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 3 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level1.elementMetatype = "ABE" level1.objectHeight = 120 level1.objectWidth = 345 level1.horizOffset = 20 level1.horizSpace = 10 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 10
'level1.objectStyle.fillColor = colorDeepSkyBlue 'level1.objectStyle.lineWidth = 2 level1.objectStyle.lineColor = colorSilver level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 18 level1.objectStyle.fontColor = colorGray40
levelList.Add 1, level1
' *** SECOND LEVEL ***
set level2 = New HierarchyLevel
level2.numObjects = 3 level2.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level2.elementMetatype = "ABE" level2.objectHeight = 60 level2.objectWidth = 150 level2.horizOffset = 20 level2.horizSpace = 5 level2.vertOffset = 60 level2.vertSpace = 5
'level2.objectStyle.fillColor = colorDeepSkyBlue 'level2.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 level2.objectStyle.lineColor = colorSilver level2.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level2.objectStyle.fontSize = 10 level2.objectStyle.fontColor = colorGray40
levelList.Add 2, level2
' *** THIRD LEVEL ***
set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 3 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION
level3.elementMetatype = "ABE" level3.objectHeight = 60 level3.objectWidth = 120 level3.horizOffset = 20 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 3
'level3.objectStyle.fillColor = colorLightCoral 'level3.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 level3.objectStyle.lineColor = colorSilver level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 level3.objectStyle.fontColor = colorGray40
levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL ***
set level4 = New HierarchyLevel
level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "ABE" level4.objectHeight = 60 level4.objectWidth = 120 level4.horizOffset = 10 level4.horizSpace = 1 level4.vertOffset = 50 level4.vertSpace = 1 'level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorLightSkyBlue 'level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorSilver level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorGray40
levelList.Add 4, level4
set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Connector -> Make Compositions Unidirectional" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
' Script to make all composition relationships unidirectional on an open diagram. '
Dim project as EA.Project
sub Start()
Session.Output( "Make Compositions Unidirectional v1.0" ) Session.Output( "=====================================" )
dim theDiagram as EA.Diagram
set project = Repository.GetProjectInterface()
set theDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram
if not theDiagram is nothing then
MakeCompositionsUnidirectional theDiagram
else
MsgBox( "This script requires a diagram be opened." & chr(10) & _ "Please open a diagram from the Project Browser and try again." )
end if
Session.Output( "Done!" )
end sub
sub MakeCompositionsUnidirectional ( theDiagram )
dim aDiagramLink as EA.DiagramLink dim connectorID dim aConnector as EA.Connector dim newTag as EA.ConnectorTag
for each aDiagramLink in theDiagram.DiagramLinks
connectorID = aDiagramLink.ConnectorID
set aConnector = Repository.GetConnectorByID( connectorID)
aConnector.ClientEnd.Navigable = "Navigable" aConnector.ClientEnd.Update
aConnector.SupplierEnd.Navigable = "Unspecified" aConnector.SupplierEnd.Update
'aConnector.Update
next
Repository.ReloadDiagram( theDiagram.DiagramID )
end sub
Start

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Elements -> Relocate Selected Diagram " Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
' Script to move the selected elements on a diagram into the same package (in the browser) as the diagram. '
Dim project as EA.Project
sub Start()
dim diagram as EA.Diagram set project = Repository.GetProjectInterface() set diagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram if not diagram is nothing then RelocateDiagramElements diagram end if
end sub
sub RelocateDiagramElements( diagram)
dim diagramObject as EA.DiagramObject dim diagramPackageID dim elementID dim element as EA.Element
diagramPackageID = diagram.PackageID
for each diagramObject in diagram.SelectedObjects
elementID = diagramObject.ElementID set element = Repository.GetElementByID(elementID) element.PackageID = diagramPackageID element.Update
next
end sub
Start

Column.value:
option explicit
' Script to change fill color of elements on a diagram based the value of the Status property. ' this can be done also with a legend
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC Diagram Script Utilities.Color Constants !INC Diagram Script Utilities.Element -> Change Color
sub OnDiagramScript
dim ruleArray(2) dim colorArray(2)
ruleArray(0) = "element.Status = ""Approved""" ruleArray(1) = "element.Status = ""Proposed""" ruleArray(2) = "element.Status = ""Mandatory"""
colorArray(0) = colorLightSkyBlue colorArray(1) = colorPaleGreen colorArray(2) = colorLightCoral
ChangeElementColor ruleArray, colorArray
end sub
OnDiagramScript

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Change Element Color" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' Script Name: ChangeElementColorByRule ' Author: Giu Platania ' Purpose: Change the fill color of elements on the current diagram based on an array of rules. ' Methods: ChangeElementColor ' Date: 2025-08-06 ' Version: 1.0
Option Explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript
' Changes element background color in the current diagram according to ruleArray and colorArray. ' Each rule should be a function that takes an EA.Element and returns True/False. Sub ChangeElementColor(ruleArray, colorArray)
Dim currentDiagram As EA.Diagram Dim diagramObject As EA.DiagramObject Dim backgroundColor Dim elementID Dim element As EA.Element Dim index Dim rule
Set currentDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram()
If Not currentDiagram Is Nothing Then
Repository.SaveDiagram currentDiagram.DiagramID
For Each diagramObject In currentDiagram.DiagramObjects
elementID = diagramObject.ElementID Set element = Repository.GetElementByID(elementID)
For index = 0 To UBound(ruleArray)
Set rule = ruleArray(index) ' rule is a function
If rule(element) Then backgroundColor = colorArray(index) ' Preserve other style properties diagramObject.Style = "BCol=" & backgroundColor & ";" & diagramObject.Style diagramObject.Update End If
Next
Next
Repository.ReloadDiagram currentDiagram.DiagramID
Else Session.Prompt "This script requires a diagram to be visible", promptOK End If
End Sub
' --- Example Usage --- ' To use this, define an array of functions and color codes, then call ChangeElementColor. ' ' Example (to be run in the Script window, not inside the function above): ' ' Dim rules(1) ' Dim colors(1) ' Set rules(0) = GetRuleByType("Class") ' colors(0) = 255 ' Red for "Class" ' Set rules(1) = GetRuleByType("Interface") ' colors(1) = 16711935 ' Magenta for "Interface" ' ChangeElementColor rules, colors ' ' Function GetRuleByType(wantedType) ' Set GetRuleByType = GetRef("Function(element) GetRuleByType_Impl(element, wantedType): End Function") ' End Function ' ' Function GetRuleByType_Impl(element, wantedType) ' GetRuleByType_Impl = (LCase(element.Type) = LCase(wantedType)) ' End Function '
' -----------------------

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Set Current Diagram Connector Line Style" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' Script to update style of all connectors on a diagram. '
const STYLE_DELIMITER = ";" const STYLE_ASSIGNMENT = "="
sub SetCurrentDiagramConnectorLineStyle(updateStyleList)
dim theDiagram as EA.Diagram
set theDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram
theDiagram.Update
SetDiagramConnectorLineStyle theDiagram, updateStyleList
theDiagram.Update
end sub
sub SetDiagramConnectorLineStyle( theDiagram, updateStyleList)
dim diagramLink as EA.DiagramLink dim updateStyleArray dim updateStyle
updateStyleArray = Split(updateStyleList, STYLE_DELIMITER)
for each diagramLink in theDiagram.DiagramLinks
for each updateStyle in updateStyleArray SetDiagramLinkStyle diagramLink, updateStyle next
diagramLink.Update
next
Repository.ReloadDiagram theDiagram.DiagramID
end sub
sub SetDiagramLinkStyle( diagramLink, updateStyle)
dim updateStylePartArray dim updateStyleName dim lineStyleList dim lineStyleArray dim lineStyleIndex dim lineStyle dim styleFound
updateStylePartArray = Split(updateStyle, STYLE_ASSIGNMENT)
updateStyleName = updateStylePartArray(0)
lineStyleList = diagramLink.Style
lineStyleArray = Split(lineStyleList, STYLE_DELIMITER)
lineStyleIndex = 0 styleFound = false
for each lineStyle in lineStyleArray
if InStr( lineStyle, updateStyleName & STYLE_ASSIGNMENT) then
lineStyle = updateStyle
lineStyleArray(lineStyleIndex) = lineStyle
styleFound = true
end if
lineStyleIndex = lineStyleIndex + 1
next
lineStyleList = Join(lineStyleArray, STYLE_DELIMITER)
if not( styleFound) then lineStyleList = lineStyleList & updateStyle & STYLE_DELIMITER end if
diagramLink.Style = lineStyleList
end sub

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Set Current Diagram Objects Style" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' Script to update style for all diagram objects of a specific type. '
const STYLE_DELIMITER = ";" const STYLE_ASSIGNMENT = "="
sub SetCurrentDiagramObjectsStyle(elementMetaType, updateStyleList)
dim theDiagram as EA.Diagram
set theDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram
theDiagram.Update
SetDiagramObjectsStyle theDiagram, elementMetaType, updateStyleList
theDiagram.Update
end sub
sub SetDiagramObjectsStyle( theDiagram, elementMetaType, updateStyleList)
dim diagramObject as EA.DiagramObject dim diagramElement as EA.Element dim elementID dim updateStyleArray dim updateStyle
updateStyleArray = Split(updateStyleList, STYLE_DELIMITER)
for each diagramObject in theDiagram.DiagramObjects
elementID = diagramObject.ElementID
set diagramElement = Repository.GetElementByID(elementID)
if diagramElement.metaType = elementMetaType then
for each updateStyle in updateStyleArray SetDiagramObjectStyle diagramObject, updateStyle next
diagramObject.Update
end if
next
Repository.ReloadDiagram theDiagram.DiagramID
end sub
sub SetDiagramObjectStyle( diagramObject, updateStyle)
dim updateStylePartArray dim updateStyleName dim lineStyleList dim lineStyleArray dim lineStyleIndex dim lineStyle dim styleFound
updateStylePartArray = Split(updateStyle, STYLE_ASSIGNMENT)
updateStyleName = updateStylePartArray(0)
lineStyleList = diagramObject.Style
lineStyleArray = Split(lineStyleList, STYLE_DELIMITER)
lineStyleIndex = 0 styleFound = false
for each lineStyle in lineStyleArray
if InStr( lineStyle, updateStyleName & STYLE_ASSIGNMENT) then
lineStyle = updateStyle
lineStyleArray(lineStyleIndex) = lineStyle
styleFound = true
end if
lineStyleIndex = lineStyleIndex + 1
next
lineStyleList = Join(lineStyleArray, STYLE_DELIMITER)
if not( styleFound) then lineStyleList = lineStyleList & updateStyle & STYLE_DELIMITER end if
diagramObject.Style = lineStyleList
end sub

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Connector -> Map Diagram Elements" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' ' Script to create new relationships between a single selected element on a diagram and all other elements on the same diagram. ' ' option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript
sub onDiagramScript()
dim currentDiagram as EA.Diagram dim selectedObjectList as EA.Collection dim selectedObject as EA.DiagramObject dim connType ' as String dim connStereotype ' as String
set currentDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram()
if not currentDiagram is nothing then
Repository.SaveDiagram currentDiagram.DiagramID
set selectedObjectList = currentDiagram.SelectedObjects
if selectedObjectList.Count = 1 then
connType = InputBox("Enter mapped connector type:", , "Dependency")
if not IsEmpty( connType) then
connStereotype = InputBox("Enter mapped connector stereotype:", , "Impacts")
if not IsEmpty( connStereotype) then
set selectedObject = selectedObjectList.GetAt(0)
mapDiagramElements currentDiagram, selectedObject, connType, connStereotype
end if
end if
else Session.Prompt "Must select at least one (and only one) element on this diagram.", promptOK end if else Session.Prompt "This script requires a diagram to be visible", promptOK end if
end sub
sub mapDiagramElements( diagram, selectedDiagramObject, connType, connStereotype)
dim selectedElementID ' as Integer dim selectedElement as EA.Element dim relatedDiagramObject as EA.DiagramObject dim relatedElementID ' as Integer dim relatedElement as EA.Element
diagram.Update
Session.Output vbCRLF & "Map Diagram Elements"
selectedElementID = selectedDiagramObject.ElementID
set selectedElement = Repository.GetElementByID( selectedElementID)
for each relatedDiagramObject in diagram.DiagramObjects
if relatedDiagramObject.ElementID <> selectedDiagramObject.ElementID then
relatedElementID = relatedDiagramObject.ElementID
set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID)
addConnector selectedElement, connType, connStereotype, relatedElement
end if
next
Repository.ReloadDiagram( diagram.DiagramID)
Session.Output "Finished!"
end sub
function addConnector( fromElement, connType, connStereotype, toElement)
dim newConnector as EA.Connector
Session.Output "- Creating new " & connStereotype & " " & connType & " relationship from " & fromElement.Name & " to " & toElement.Name & "..."
set newConnector = fromElement.Connectors.AddNew("", connType)
newConnector.Stereotype = connStereotype newConnector.SupplierID = toElement.ElementID
newConnector.Update
fromElement.Connectors.Refresh
set addConnector = newConnector
end function
onDiagramScript

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Cloning -> Clone Element" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' ' Diagram script to a new version of the selected elements on a diagram. This will create a copy of an element ' including its built-in properties, tagged values, relationships, child elements, and child diagrams. It will ' also create an <<clone>> generalization to the original version to represent its previous version. '
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC TM Forum Diagram Script Utilities.Clone Routines
dim lockError ' as Boolean
sub Start()
dim currDiagram as EA.Diagram
set currDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram
if currDiagram is nothing then Session.Prompt "This script requires a diagram to be visible", promptOK else if currDiagram.IsLocked then Session.Prompt "Cannot clone elements on locked diagram", promptOK else CopyDiagramElements currDiagram end if end if
end sub
sub CopyDiagramElements( currDiagram)
dim currDiagramObject as EA.DiagramObject dim diagramPackageID
diagramPackageID = currDiagram.PackageID
for each currDiagramObject in currDiagram.SelectedObjects CreateDiagramObjectCopy currDiagram, currDiagramObject next
currDiagram.Update()
Repository.ReloadDiagram( currDiagram.DiagramID)
end sub
sub CreateDiagramObjectCopy( currDiagram, currDiagramObject)
dim currElementID dim currElement as EA.Element dim diagramPackageID dim diagramPackage as EA.Package dim newElement as EA.Element
lockError = false
currElementID = currDiagramObject.ElementID
set currElement = Repository.GetElementByID( currElementID)
diagramPackageID = currDiagram.PackageID
set diagramPackage = Repository.GetPackageByID( diagramPackageID)
set newElement = diagramPackage.Elements.AddNew( currElement.Name, currElement.Type)
Repository.EnsureOutputVisible "Script"
Session.Output String( 40, "-") Session.Output "Creating clone of '" & currElement.Name & "'..."
CloneElement currElement, newElement
SwapDiagramObject currDiagram, currDiagramObject, currElement, newElement
if lockError then Session.Prompt "One or more relationhips could not be cloned due to locking restrictions." & vbCRLF & vbCRLF & "Examine the Script tab of the System Output window for details.", promptOK end if
Session.Output "Finished!"
end sub
sub CloneElement( currElement, newElement)
dim extendConn as EA.Connector dim clonedGUIDTag as EA.TaggedValue
'CloneElementParent currElement
CopyElementProperties currElement, newElement
Repository.EnsureOutputVisible "Script"
'CopyElementAttributes 'CopyElementConstraints 'CopyElementCustomProperties 'CopyElementEfforts 'CopyElementFiles 'CopyElementIssues 'CopyElementMethods 'CopyElementMetrics 'CopyElementPartitions 'CopyElementRequirements 'CopyElementResources 'CopyElementRisks 'CopyElementScenarios 'CopyElementStateTransitions 'CopyElementTemplateParameters 'CopyElementTests
CopyElementTaggedValues currElement, newElement
CopyElementConnectors currElement, newElement
CopyElementDiagrams currElement, newElement
'CloneElementEmbeddedElements currElement, newElement 'CloneElementChildren currElement, newElement 'CloneStateMachines currElement, newElement
set extendConn = newElement.Connectors.AddNew( "", CLONE_TYPE)
extendConn.SupplierID = currElement.ElementID extendConn.Direction = "Source -> Destination" extendConn.Stereotype = CLONE_STEREOTYPE
extendConn.Update
newElement.Connectors.Refresh
set clonedGUIDTag = newElement.TaggedValues.GetByName( CLONED_GUID)
if clonedGUIDTag is nothing then set clonedGUIDTag = newElement.TaggedValues.AddNew( CLONED_GUID, "") end if
clonedGUIDTag.Value = currElement.ElementGUID
clonedGUIDTag.Update
newElement.TaggedValues.Refresh
end sub
sub CloneElementChildren( currElement, newElement)
dim currChildElement as EA.Element dim newChildElement as EA.Element
if currElement.Elements.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 2, ".") & "Child Elements"
for each currChildElement in currElement.Elements
set newChildElement = newElement.Elements.AddNew( currElement.Name, currElement.Type)
CloneElement currChildElement, newChildElement
next
end if
end sub
sub CopyElementProperties( currElement, newElement)
newElement.Abstract = currElement.Abstract newElement.ActionFlags = currElement.ActionFlags newElement.Alias = currElement.Alias newElement.ClassifierID = currElement.ClassifierID newElement.Complexity = currElement.Complexity newElement.Difficulty = currElement.Difficulty newElement.EventFlags = currElement.EventFlags newElement.ExtensionPoints = currElement.ExtensionPoints newElement.Genfile = currElement.Genfile newElement.Genlinks = currElement.Genlinks newElement.Gentype = currElement.Gentype newElement.Header1 = currElement.Header1 newElement.Header2 = currElement.Header2 newElement.IsActive = currElement.IsActive newElement.IsLeaf = currElement.IsLeaf newElement.IsNew = currElement.IsNew newElement.IsRoot = currElement.IsRoot newElement.IsSpec = currElement.IsSpec newElement.Multiplicity = currElement.Multiplicity newElement.Notes = currElement.Notes newElement.Persistence = currElement.Persistence newElement.Phase = currElement.Phase newElement.Priority = currElement.Priority newElement.PropertyType = currElement.PropertyType newElement.RunState = currElement.RunState newElement.Status = currElement.Status newElement.StereotypeEx = currElement.StereotypeEx newElement.StyleEx = currElement.StyleEx newElement.Subtype = currElement.Subtype newElement.Tablespace = currElement.Tablespace newElement.Tag = currElement.Tag newElement.Visibility = currElement.Visibility
newElement.Name = InputBox( "Enter new element name", "New Element Name", currElement.Name) newElement.Version = InputBox( "Enter new element version", "New Element Version", currElement.Version)
newElement.Update
newElement.TaggedValues.Refresh
end sub
sub CopyElementTaggedValues( currElement, newElement)
dim currTaggedValue as EA.TaggedValue dim newTaggedValue as EA.TaggedValue
if currElement.TaggedValues.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 2, ".") & "Tagged Values"
for each currTaggedValue in currElement.TaggedValues
set newTaggedValue = newElement.TaggedValues.GetByName( currTaggedValue.Name)
if newTaggedValue is nothing then set newTaggedValue = newElement.TaggedValues.AddNew( currTaggedValue.Name,"") end if
newTaggedValue.Value = currTaggedValue.Value newTaggedValue.Notes = currTaggedValue.Notes
newTaggedValue.Update
next
end if
newElement.TaggedValues.Refresh
end sub
sub CopyElementConnectors( currElement, newElement)
dim currConnector as EA.Connector dim newConnector as EA.Connector dim clientEndLocked ' as Boolean dim clientElement as EA.Element dim lockMsg ' as String
if currElement.Connectors.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 2, ".") & "Connectors"
for each currConnector in currElement.Connectors
if not( currConnector.Type = CLONE_TYPE and currConnector.Stereotype = CLONE_STEREOTYPE) then
Session.Output String( 4, ".") & "Cloning Connector " & currConnector.ConnectorGUID & " (" & currConnector.ConnectorID & ") " & currConnector.Type & " <<" & currConnector.Stereotype & ">> "
'set newConnector = newElement.Connectors.AddNew( currConnector.Name, currConnector.Type) set newConnector = createNewConnector( currConnector, currElement, newElement)
'if currConnector.ClientID = currElement.ElementID then ' newConnector.ClientID = newElement.ElementID ' newConnector.SupplierID = currConnector.SupplierID ' clientEndLocked = false 'else
'if currElement.Locked then ' clientEndLocked = true 'else ' newConnector.ClientID = currConnector.ClientID ' newConnector.SupplierID = newElement.ElementID ' clientEndLocked = false 'end if
'end if
if clientEndLocked then
set clientElement = Repository.GetElementByID( currConnector.ClientID)
lockMsg = "Cannot create " & currConnector.Stereotype & " " & currConnector.Type lockMsg = lockMsg & " from LOCKED client element '" & clientElement.Name & "' " & clientElement.Stereotype & " " & clientElement.Type lockMsg = lockMsg & " to new cloned element."
Session.Output lockMsg
lockError = true
else CopyElementConnector currConnector, newConnector end if
end if
next
newElement.Connectors.Refresh
end if
end sub
function createNewConnector( currConnector, currElement, newElement)
dim newConnectorClientID ' as Integer dim newConnectorSupplierID ' as Integer dim sqlString ' as String dim typeLib ' as Scriptlet.TypeLib dim newGUID ' as String dim newConnector as EA.Connector dim testConnector as EA.Connector
if currConnector.ClientID = currElement.ElementID then newConnectorClientID = newElement.ElementID newConnectorSupplierID = currConnector.SupplierID else newConnectorClientID = currConnector.ClientID newConnectorSupplierID = newElement.ElementID end if
set typeLib = CreateObject( "Scriptlet.TypeLib")
newGUID = typeLib.Guid newGUID = Left( newGUID, Len( newGUID) - 2) ' remove null termination characters at end
sqlString = "INSERT INTO t_connector " sqlString = sqlString & "(Name, Direction, Connector_Type, Start_Object_ID, End_Object_ID, ea_guid, "
if currConnector.Stereotype <> "" then sqlString = sqlString & "Stereotype, " end if
sqlString = sqlString & "PDATA1, PDATA2, PDATA3, PDATA4, PDATA5) " sqlString = sqlString & "VALUES (" sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.Name & "', " sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.Direction & "', " sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.Type & "', " sqlString = sqlString & newConnectorClientID & ", " sqlString = sqlString & newConnectorSupplierID & ", " sqlString = sqlString & "'" & newGUID & "', "
if currConnector.Stereotype <> "" then sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.Stereotype & "', " end if
sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.MiscData(0) & "', " sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.MiscData(1) & "', " sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.MiscData(2) & "', " sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.MiscData(3) & "', " sqlString = sqlString & "'" & currConnector.MiscData(4) & "')"
Repository.Execute sqlString
set createNewConnector = Repository.GetConnectorByGuid( newGUID)
'currElement.Connectors.Refresh
'set newConnector = nothing
'for each testConnector in currElement.Connectors ' if testConnector.ConnectorGUID = newGUID then ' set newConnector = testConnector ' exit for ' end if 'next
'set createNewConnector = newConnector
end function
sub CopyElementConnector( currConnector, newConnector)
dim clonedGUIDTag as EA.ConnectorTag
newConnector.Alias = currConnector.Alias newConnector.Color = currConnector.Color newConnector.DiagramID = currConnector.DiagramID newConnector.Direction = currConnector.Direction newConnector.EndPointX = currConnector.EndPointX newConnector.EndPointY = currConnector.EndPointY newConnector.EventFlags = currConnector.EventFlags newConnector.IsLeaf = currConnector.IsLeaf newConnector.IsRoot = currConnector.IsRoot newConnector.IsSpec = currConnector.IsSpec newConnector.Notes = currConnector.Notes newConnector.RouteStyle = currConnector.RouteStyle newConnector.SequenceNo = currConnector.SequenceNo newConnector.StartPointX = currConnector.StartPointX newConnector.StartPointY = currConnector.StartPointY newConnector.StateFlags = currConnector.StateFlags newConnector.StereotypeEx = currConnector.StereotypeEx newConnector.StyleEx = currConnector.StyleEx newConnector.Subtype = currConnector.Subtype newConnector.TransitionAction = currConnector.TransitionAction newConnector.TransitionEvent = currConnector.TransitionEvent newConnector.TransitionGuard = currConnector.TransitionGuard newConnector.VirtualInheritance = currConnector.VirtualInheritance newConnector.Width = currConnector.Width
On Error Resume Next
newConnector.Update
if err.Number <> 0 then Session.Output "Error saving cloned connector: " & err.Description end if
On Error Goto 0
CopyConnectorEnd currConnector.ClientEnd, newConnector.ClientEnd CopyConnectorEnd currConnector.SupplierEnd, newConnector.SupplierEnd
'CopyConnectorConstraints CopyConnectorConveyedItems currConnector, newConnector 'CopyConnectorMessageArguments CopyConnectorTaggedValues currConnector, newConnector 'CopyConnectorTemplateBindings
set clonedGUIDTag = newConnector.TaggedValues.GetByName( CLONED_GUID)
if clonedGUIDTag is nothing then set clonedGUIDTag = newConnector.TaggedValues.AddNew( CLONED_GUID, "") end if
clonedGUIDTag.Value = currConnector.ConnectorGUID
clonedGUIDTag.Update
newConnector.TaggedValues.Refresh
end sub
sub CopyConnectorEnd( currConnectorEnd, newConnectorEnd)
newConnectorEnd.Aggregation = currConnectorEnd.Aggregation newConnectorEnd.Alias = currConnectorEnd.Alias newConnectorEnd.AllowDuplicates = currConnectorEnd.AllowDuplicates newConnectorEnd.Cardinality = currConnectorEnd.Cardinality newConnectorEnd.Constraint = currConnectorEnd.Constraint newConnectorEnd.Containment = currConnectorEnd.Containment newConnectorEnd.Derived = currConnectorEnd.Derived newConnectorEnd.DerivedUnion = currConnectorEnd.DerivedUnion newConnectorEnd.IsChangeable = currConnectorEnd.IsChangeable newConnectorEnd.Navigable = currConnectorEnd.Navigable newConnectorEnd.Ordering = currConnectorEnd.Ordering newConnectorEnd.OwnedByClassifier = currConnectorEnd.OwnedByClassifier newConnectorEnd.Qualifier = currConnectorEnd.Qualifier newConnectorEnd.Role = currConnectorEnd.Role newConnectorEnd.RoleNote = currConnectorEnd.RoleNote newConnectorEnd.StereotypeEx = currConnectorEnd.StereotypeEx newConnectorEnd.Visibility = currConnectorEnd.Visibility
newConnectorEnd.Update
end sub
sub CopyConnectorConveyedItems( currConnector, newConnector)
dim conveyedItem as EA.Element
if currConnector.ConveyedItems.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 6, ".") & "Conveyed Items"
for each conveyedItem in currConnector.ConveyedItems newConnector.ConveyedItems.AddNew conveyedItem.ElementGUID, "" next
newConnector.ConveyedItems.Refresh
end if
end sub
sub CopyConnectorTaggedValues( currConnector, newConnector)
dim currTaggedValue as EA.ConnectorTag dim newTaggedValue as EA.ConnectorTag
if currConnector.TaggedValues.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 6, ".") & "Tagged Values"
for each currTaggedValue in currConnector.TaggedValues
set newTaggedValue = newConnector.TaggedValues.GetByName( currTaggedValue.Name)
if newTaggedValue is nothing then set newTaggedValue = newConnector.TaggedValues.AddNew( currTaggedValue.Name, "") end if
newTaggedValue.Value = currTaggedValue.Value newTaggedValue.Notes = currTaggedValue.Notes
newTaggedValue.Update
next
newConnector.TaggedValues.Refresh
end if
end sub
sub CopyElementDiagrams( currElement, newElement)
dim currDiagram as EA.Diagram
if currElement.Diagrams.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 2, ".") & "Diagrams"
for each currDiagram in currElement.Diagrams CopyElementDiagram currDiagram, newElement next
newElement.IsComposite = currElement.IsComposite
newElement.Update
newElement.Diagrams.Refresh
end if
end sub
sub CopyElementDiagram( currDiagram, newElement)
dim newDiagram as EA.Diagram
Session.Output String( 4, ".") & "Diagram '" & currDiagram.Name
set newDiagram = newElement.Diagrams.AddNew( currDiagram.Name, currDiagram.Type)
newDiagram.cx = currDiagram.cx newDiagram.cy = currDiagram.cy newDiagram.ExtendedStyle = currDiagram.ExtendedStyle newDiagram.FilterElements = currDiagram.FilterElements newDiagram.HighlightImports = currDiagram.HighlightImports newDiagram.Notes = currDiagram.Notes newDiagram.Orientation = currDiagram.Orientation newDiagram.Scale = currDiagram.Scale newDiagram.ShowDetails = currDiagram.ShowDetails newDiagram.ShowPackageContents = currDiagram.ShowPackageContents newDiagram.ShowPrivate = currDiagram.ShowPrivate newDiagram.ShowProtected = currDiagram.ShowProtected newDiagram.ShowPublic = currDiagram.ShowPublic newDiagram.Stereotype = currDiagram.Stereotype newDiagram.StyleEx = currDiagram.StyleEx newDiagram.Version = currDiagram.Version
newDiagram.Update
CopyDiagramObjects currDiagram, newDiagram
CopyDiagramLinks currDiagram, newDiagram
CopyDiagramSwimlanes currDiagram, newDiagram
end sub
sub CopyDiagramObjects( currDiagram, newDiagram)
dim currDiagramObject as EA.DiagramObject
if currDiagram.DiagramObjects.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 6, ".") & "Objects"
for each currDiagramObject in currDiagram.DiagramObjects CopyDiagramObject currDiagramObject, newDiagram next
newDiagram.DiagramObjects.Refresh
end if
end sub
sub CopyDiagramLinks( currDiagram, newDiagram)
dim currLink as EA.DiagramLink dim newLink as EA.DiagramLink
if currDiagram.DiagramLinks.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 6, ".") & "Links"
for each currLink in currDiagram.DiagramLinks
set newLink = CopyDiagramLink( currLink, newDiagram)
newLink.Update
next
newDiagram.DiagramLinks.Refresh
end if
end sub
sub CopyDiagramSwimlanes( currDiagram, newDiagram)
dim currSwimlane ' as EA.Swimlane
newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Bold = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Bold newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.FontColor = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.FontColor newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.HideClassifier = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.HideClassifier newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.HideNames = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.HideNames newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.LineColor = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.LineColor newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.LineWidth = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.LineWidth newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Locked = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Locked newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Orientation = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Orientation newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.ShowInTitleBar = currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.ShowInTitleBar
if currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Swimlanes.Count > 0 then
Session.Output String( 6, ".") & "Swimlanes"
for each currSwimlane in currDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Swimlanes CopyDiagramSwimlane currSwimlane, newDiagram next
newDiagram.Update
end if
end sub
sub CopyDiagramSwimlane( currSwimlane, newDiagram)
dim newSwimlane ' as EA.Swimlane
set newSwimlane = newDiagram.SwimlaneDef.Swimlanes.Add( currSwimlane.Title, currSwimlane.Width)
newSwimlane.BackColor = currSwimlane.BackColor newSwimlane.ClassifierGuid = currSwimlane.ClassifierGuid
end sub
Start

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Cloning -> Replace Diagram Element" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' ' Diagram script to replace the selected element on a diagram with the currently selected element in the ' project browser. '
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC SSNA Diagram Script Utilities.Clone Routines
sub OnDiagramScript()
dim currDiagram as EA.Diagram dim selectedObjects as EA.Collection dim selectedDiagramObject as EA.DiagramObject dim selectedElements as EA.Collection dim selectedBrowserElement as EA.Element
set currDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram()
if not currDiagram is nothing then
set selectedObjects = currDiagram.SelectedObjects
if selectedObjects.Count = 1 then
set selectedDiagramObject = selectedObjects.GetAt(0)
set selectedElements = Repository.GetTreeSelectedElements
if selectedElements.Count = 1 then
set selectedBrowserElement = selectedElements.GetAt(0)
ReplaceDiagramElement currDiagram, selectedDiagramObject, selectedBrowserElement
else Session.Prompt "This script requires one (and only one) element to be selected in the Project Browser.", promptOK end if
else Session.Prompt "This script requires one (and only one) element to be selected on the diagram.", promptOK end if else Session.Prompt "This script requires a diagram to be visible", promptOK end if
end sub
sub ReplaceDiagramElement( currDiagram, currDiagramObject, newElement)
dim currElement as EA.Element
set currElement = Repository.GetElementByID( currDiagramObject.ElementID)
Repository.EnsureOutputVisible "Script"
Session.Output String( 40, "-") Session.Output "Replacing '" & currElement.Name & "' with '" & newELement.Name & "' on '" & currDiagram.Name & "' ..."
SwapDiagramObject currDiagram, currDiagramObject, currElement, newElement
Session.Output "Finished!"
end sub
OnDiagramScript

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Clone Routines" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' Common routines used in cloning and diagram object replacement.
const CLONE_TYPE = "Dependency" ' as String const CLONE_STEREOTYPE = "clone" ' as String const CLONED_GUID = "_clonedGUID" ' as String
dim linkError ' as Boolean
sub SwapDiagramObject( currDiagram, currDiagramObject, currElement, newElement)
dim newDiagramObject as EA.DiagramObject
linkError = false
set newDiagramObject = CopyDiagramObject( currDiagramObject, currDiagram)
newDiagramObject.ElementID = newElement.ElementID
newDiagramObject.Update
CopyClonedDiagramLinks currDiagram, currElement, newElement
DeleteOriginalDiagramObject currDiagram, currDiagramObject
Repository.ReloadDiagram currDiagram.DiagramID
if linkError then Session.Prompt "One or more cloned relationships could not be found." & vbCRLF & vbCRLF & "Examine the Script tab of the System Output window for details.", promptOK end if
end sub
sub CopyClonedDiagramLinks( currDiagram, currElement, newElement)
dim newConnector as EA.Connector dim currConnector as EA.Connector dim currLink as EA.DiagramLink dim currConnectorID ' as Integer dim newLink as EA.DiagramLink
Session.Output String( 2, ".") & "Copying cloned diagram links"
for each newConnector in newElement.Connectors
if newConnector.Type <> CLONE_TYPE and newConnector.Stereotype <> CLONE_STEREOTYPE then
set currConnector = FindElementConnectorByGUID( currElement, newConnector)
if not( currConnector is nothing) then
for each currLink in currDiagram.DiagramLinks
if currLink.ConnectorID = currConnector.ConnectorID then
currLink.IsHidden = true currLink.Update
set newLink = CopyDiagramLink( currLink, currDiagram)
newLink.ConnectorID = newConnector.ConnectorID newLInk.IsHidden = false
newLink.Update
end if
next
end if
end if
next
currDiagram.DiagramLinks.Refresh
end sub
function FindElementConnectorByGUID( currElement, newConnector)
dim clonedConnectorGUIDTag as EA.ConnectorTag dim clonedConnectorGUID ' as String dim currConnector as EA.Connector dim connectorFound ' as Boolean
set clonedConnectorGUIDTag = newConnector.TaggedValues.GetByName( CLONED_GUID)
connectorFound = false
if clonedConnectorGUIDTag is nothing then
Session.Output "Cloned connector GUID tagged value missing from new connector " & newConnector.Type & " " & newConnector.ConnectorGUID & ". Unable to locate original connector."
linkError = true
else
clonedConnectorGUID = clonedConnectorGUIDTag.Value
for each currConnector in currElement.Connectors
if currConnector.ConnectorGUID = clonedConnectorGUID then connectorFound = true exit for end if
next
end if
if connectorFound then set FindElementConnectorByGUID = currConnector else set FindElementConnectorByGUID = nothing end if
end function
sub DeleteOriginalDiagramObject( currDiagram, origDiagramObject)
dim objectCount ' as Integer dim objectIndex ' as Integer dim currDiagramObject as EA.DiagramObject
objectCount = currDiagram.DiagramObjects.Count
for objectIndex = objectCount - 1 to 0 step -1
set currDiagramObject = currDiagram.DiagramObjects.GetAt( objectIndex)
if currDiagramObject.ElementID = origDiagramObject.ElementID then
currDiagram.DiagramObjects.DeleteAt objectIndex, false
exit for
end if
next
currDiagram.DiagramObjects.Refresh
end sub
function CopyDiagramObject( currDiagramObject, newDiagram)
dim newDiagramObject as EA.DiagramObject
set newDiagramObject = newDiagram.DiagramObjects.AddNew( "", "")
newDiagramObject.BackgroundColor = currDiagramObject.BackgroundColor newDiagramObject.BorderColor = currDiagramObject.BorderColor newDiagramObject.BorderLineWidth = currDiagramObject.BorderLineWidth newDiagramObject.bottom = currDiagramObject.bottom newDiagramObject.ElementDisplayMode = currDiagramObject.ElementDisplayMode newDiagramObject.ElementID = currDiagramObject.ElementID newDiagramObject.FeatureStereotypesToHide = currDiagramObject.FeatureStereotypesToHide newDiagramObject.FontBold = currDiagramObject.FontBold newDiagramObject.FontColor = currDiagramObject.FontColor newDiagramObject.FontItalic = currDiagramObject.FontItalic newDiagramObject.fontName = currDiagramObject.fontName newDiagramObject.fontSize = currDiagramObject.fontSize newDiagramObject.FontUnderline = currDiagramObject.FontUnderline newDiagramObject.IsSelectable = currDiagramObject.IsSelectable newDiagramObject.left = currDiagramObject.left newDiagramObject.right = currDiagramObject.right newDiagramObject.Sequence = currDiagramObject.Sequence newDiagramObject.ShowComposedDiagram = currDiagramObject.ShowComposedDiagram newDiagramObject.ShowConstraints = currDiagramObject.ShowConstraints newDiagramObject.ShowFormattedNotes = currDiagramObject.ShowFormattedNotes newDiagramObject.ShowFullyQualifiedTags = currDiagramObject.ShowFullyQualifiedTags newDiagramObject.ShowInheritedAttributes = currDiagramObject.ShowInheritedAttributes newDiagramObject.ShowInheritedConstraints = currDiagramObject.ShowInheritedConstraints newDiagramObject.ShowInheritedOperations = currDiagramObject.ShowInheritedOperations newDiagramObject.ShowInheritedResponsibilities = currDiagramObject.ShowInheritedResponsibilities newDiagramObject.ShowInheritedTags = currDiagramObject.ShowInheritedTags newDiagramObject.ShowNotes = currDiagramObject.ShowNotes newDiagramObject.ShowPackageAttributes = currDiagramObject.ShowPackageAttributes newDiagramObject.ShowPackageOperations = currDiagramObject.ShowPackageOperations newDiagramObject.ShowPortType = currDiagramObject.ShowPortType newDiagramObject.ShowPrivateAttributes = currDiagramObject.ShowPrivateAttributes newDiagramObject.ShowPrivateOperations = currDiagramObject.ShowPrivateAttributes newDiagramObject.ShowProtectedAttributes = currDiagramObject.ShowProtectedAttributes newDiagramObject.ShowProtectedOperations = currDiagramObject.ShowProtectedOperations newDiagramObject.ShowPublicAttributes = currDiagramObject.ShowPublicAttributes newDiagramObject.ShowPublicOperations = currDiagramObject.ShowPublicOperations newDiagramObject.ShowResponsibilities = currDiagramObject.ShowResponsibilities newDiagramObject.ShowRunstates = currDiagramObject.ShowRunstates newDiagramObject.ShowStructuredCompartments = currDiagramObject.ShowStructuredCompartments newDiagramObject.ShowTags = currDiagramObject.ShowTags newDiagramObject.Style = currDiagramObject.Style newDiagramObject.TextAlign = currDiagramObject.TextAlign newDiagramObject.top = currDiagramObject.top
newDiagramObject.Update
set CopyDiagramObject = newDiagramObject
end function
function CopyDiagramLink( currLink, newDiagram)
dim newLink as EA.DiagramLink
set newLink = newDiagram.DiagramLinks.AddNew( "", "")
newLink.ConnectorID = currLink.ConnectorID newLink.Geometry = currLink.Geometry newLink.HiddenLabels = currLink.HiddenLabels newLink.IsHidden = currLink.IsHidden newLink.LineColor = currLink.LineColor newLink.LineStyle = currLink.LineStyle newLink.LineWidth = currLink.LineWidth newLink.Path = currLink.Path newLink.SuppressSegment = currLink.SuppressSegment newLink.Style = currLink.Style
set CopyDiagramLink = newLink
end function

Column.value: <Script Name="SID- Create ABE Diagram flat" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
' creates a diagram inside each ABE located in a package
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
select case treeSelectedType
case otPackage
set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList
for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "ABE" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "ABE", false end if next
case else
Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK
end select
end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript
sub Test(packageGUID)
dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element
set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID)
set levelList = getDiagramLevelList
for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "ABE" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if next
end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 3 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "Vertical" level1.objectHeight = 100 level1.objectWidth = 200 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20
level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 12 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 9 level2.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "ABE" level2.objectHeight = 60 level2.objectWidth = 150 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 50 level2.vertSpace = 10
level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontname = "ABE" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 9
levellist.add 2, level2
set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="DMM - Create lev 2 Diagram" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
' create a diagram of DMM the first 2 levels of capabilities !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
select case treeSelectedType
case otPackage
set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject()
set levelList = getDiagramLevelList
for each element in package.Elements for each subElement in element.Elements if subElement.MetaType = "Capability" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram subElement, levelList, "Custom", false end if next next
case else
Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK
end select
end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test "{66A70E55-2B99-4e54-8893-B0D7224818DD}"
sub Test(packageGUID)
dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element
set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID)
set levelList = getDiagramLevelList
for each element in package.Elements for each subElement in element.Elements if subElement.MetaType = "Capability" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram subElement, levelList, "Custom", false end if next next
end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 1 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "Capability" level1.objectHeight = 180 level1.objectWidth = 900 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 10 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 10
level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 12 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 1 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "Capability" level2.objectHeight = 35 level2.objectWidth = 880 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 0 level2.vertOffset = 30 level2.vertSpace = 0
level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 10
levellist.add 2, level2
set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="util- Set Model Stereotypes and Tagged Values" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
' Script to populate the base an elements to a set of TMF stereotypes (and migrate ' the Stereotype value to a certain tagged value. WIP
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC TM Forum Normal Scripts.Utility Scripts
sub startMigration
dim packageGUID 'as String dim package as EA.Package
packageGUID = "{E14D56DB-76A1-4146-B131-45ACEFA4C605}" 'packageGUID = "{B82523FE-2B54-4814-B8E9-A50136B760E8}"
set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid( packageGUID)
migratePackage package
Session.Output "Finished!"
end sub
sub migratePackage( package)
dim element as EA.Element dim childPackage as EA.Package
Session.Output "Migrating package '" & package.Name & "'..."
if Right( package.Name, 3) = "ABE" then ' setLifecycleStatus package.Element, "TMF_ArchiMate3::TMF_SID_ABE" mergeDuplicateTaggedValues package.Element end if
for each element in package.Elements migrateElement element next
for each childPackage in package.Packages migratePackage childPackage next
end sub
sub mergeDuplicateTaggedValues( element)
dim value 'as String dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue dim tvCount 'as Integer dim tvIndex 'as Integer
value = ""
tvCount = element.TaggedValues.Count
for tvIndex = tvCount - 1 to 0 step -1
set taggedValue = element.TaggedValues.GetAt(tvIndex)
if taggedValue.Name = "TMFStatus" then
if taggedValue.Value <> "" then value = taggedValue.Value end if element.TaggedValues.Delete( tvIndex) end if next element.TaggedValues.Refresh
'element.Update
setElementTaggedValueValue element, "SID Lifecycle Status", value
'element.Update
end sub
sub setLifecycleStatus( element, value)
dim stereotype 'as String
stereotype = element.Stereotype
element.StereotypeEx = value element.Update element.TaggedValues.Refresh
setElementTaggedValueValue element, "TMFStatus", stereotype
element.Update
end sub
sub migrateElement( element)
dim childElement as EA.Element
Session.Output "- Migrating element '" & element.Name & "' Type: " & element.Type & "..."
' select case element.Type ' case "Class" ' setLifecycleStatus element, "TMF::TMF_BusinessEntity" ' case "DataType" ' setLifecycleStatus element, "TMF::TMF_SID_DataType" ' case "Enumeration" ' setLifecycleStatus element, "TMF::TMF_SID_Enumeration" ' end select
mergeDuplicateTaggedValues element
for each childElement in element.Elements migrateElement childElement next
end sub
startMigration

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Elements-> Resize all Diagram Objects" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
' Script to scale size and position all diagram objects (but not connectors) by a specified factor. ' <1 will create smaller objects ' !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript
sub resizeDiagramObjects( scaleFactor)
dim currentDiagram as EA.Diagram dim diagramObject as EA.DiagramObject
set currentDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram() if not currentDiagram is nothing then Repository.SaveDiagram currentDiagram.DiagramID
for each diagramObject in currentDiagram.DiagramObjects diagramObject.top = diagramObject.top * scaleFactor diagramObject.bottom = diagramObject.bottom * scaleFactor diagramObject.left = diagramObject.left * scaleFactor diagramObject.right = diagramObject.right * scaleFactor diagramObject.Update next Repository.ReloadDiagram currentDiagram.DiagramID else Session.Prompt "This script requires a diagram to be visible", promptOK end if end sub
dim scaleFactor 'as Double
scaleFactor = InputBox( "Enter scaling factor (as a decimal)", "Resize Diagram Objects", "1.5")
if scaleFactor <> vbNullString then if IsNumeric(scaleFactor) then resizeDiagramObjects scaleFactor else Session.Prompt "Scaling factor must be a decimal number greater than zero.", promptOK end if end if

dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
select case treeSelectedType
case otPackage set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList
'for each element in package.Elements ' for each subElement in element.Elements ' if subElement.MetaType = "TMF DMM Dimension" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram package, levelList, "custom", false ''params: parentItem, levelList, diagramType, openDiagram ' end if ' next 'next case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK end select end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test "{66A70E55-2B99-4e54-8893-B0D7224818DD}"
sub Test(packageGUID)
dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element
set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID)
set levelList = getDiagramLevelList
for each element in package.Elements for each subElement in element.Elements if subElement.MetaType = "Metric" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram subElement, levelList, "Custom", false end if next next
end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 6 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "Metric" level1.objectHeight = 50 level1.objectWidth = 150 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 10 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 10
level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 9 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "0" ' true level1.objectStyle.fontColor = colorWhite
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 4 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "Metric" level2.objectHeight = 50 level2.objectWidth = 150 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 30 level2.vertSpace = 10
level2.objectstyle.fillColor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontName = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontSize = 8
levellist.add 2, level2 set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="util - SetPackageAuthor" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript
' Script Name: ' Author: DBC ' Purpose: ' Script to set Author property for package and its elements and diagrams. ' Date: 2022 - 04 -15
' Project Browser Script main function ' sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
' Get the type of element selected in the Project Browser dim treeSelectedType treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
' Handling Code: Uncomment any types you wish this script to support ' NOTE: You can toggle comments on multiple lines that are currently ' selected with [CTRL]+[SHIFT]+[C]. select case treeSelectedType
' case otElement ' ' Code for when an element is selected ' dim theElement as EA.Element ' set theElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() ' case otPackage ' ' Code for when a package is selected dim thePackage as EA.Package set thePackage = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject()
setpackageElementsAuthor thePackage.PackageGUID, "TMF"
' case otDiagram ' ' Code for when a diagram is selected ' dim theDiagram as EA.Diagram ' set theDiagram = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() ' ' case otAttribute ' ' Code for when an attribute is selected ' dim theAttribute as EA.Attribute ' set theAttribute = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() ' ' case otMethod ' ' Code for when a method is selected ' dim theMethod as EA.Method ' set theMethod = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject()
case else ' Error message Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK
end select
end sub
sub setpackageElementsAuthor( packageGUID, author)
dim package as EA.Package dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element dim diagram as EA.Diagram
set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid( packageGUID)
Session.Output "Updating Author property for '" & package.Name & "' package..."
package.Element.Author = author package.Element.Update
for each element in package.Elements
Session.Output "- Element '" & element.Name & "' " & element.ObjectType
element.Author = author element.Update for each subElement in element.Elements Session.Output "- Element '" & subElement.Name & "' " & subElement.ObjectType subElement.Author = author subElement.Update next next
for each diagram in package.Diagrams
Session.Output "- Diagram '" & diagram.Name & "'"
diagram.Author = author diagram.Update
next Session.Output "done'" end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript

!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subPackage as EA.Package dim subElement as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
select case treeSelectedType
case otPackage set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList
for each element in package.Elements ' for each subElement in element.Elements if element.MetaType = "Metric" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if ' next next case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK
end select
end sub

Column.value:
option explicit
' create a nested hierarchy of metricgroups diagram located in a package !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim thePackage as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
select case treeSelectedType case otPackage set thePackage = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList ' for each element in thePackage.Elements ' for each subElement in element.Elements ' if element.MetaType = "ABE" then CreateNestedHierarchyDiagram thePackage, levelList, "Metric Group", false '''params: parentItem, levelList, diagramType, openDiagram ' end if ' next ' next case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK end select end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript
sub Test(packageGUID)
dim aPackage As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) set aPackage = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList CreateNestedHierarchyDiagram aPackage, "Metric Group", levelList
end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 4 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level1.elementMetatype = "Metric Group" level1.objectHeight = 120 level1.objectWidth = 345 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 10 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 10
level1.objectStyle.fillColor = colorBlue level1.objectStyle.lineWidth = 2 level1.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 18 level1.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 1, level1
' *** SECOND LEVEL ***
set level2 = New HierarchyLevel
level2.numObjects = 3 level2.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "Metric" level2.objectHeight = 60 level2.objectWidth = 150 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 5 level2.vertOffset = 30 level2.vertSpace = 5
level2.objectStyle.fillColor = colorOrchid level2.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 level2.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level2.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level2.objectStyle.fontSize = 10 level2.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 2, level2
' *** THIRD LEVEL ***
set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 3 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION
level3.elementMetatype = "Metric" level3.objectHeight = 60 level3.objectWidth = 120 level3.horizOffset = 10 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 30 level3.vertSpace = 3
level3.objectStyle.fillColor = colorLightSteelBlue1 level3.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 level3.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 level3.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL ***
set level4 = New HierarchyLevel
level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "Metric Group" level4.objectHeight = 60 level4.objectWidth = 120 level4.horizOffset = 10 level4.horizSpace = 3 level4.vertOffset = 30 level4.vertSpace = 3 level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorAzure2 level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 4, level4
set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="eTOM - create Process Diagram Lev 2-4" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit ' ' applied to a package, will create diagram containing elements of level 2,3 and 4 for each element of the package !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "starting" select case treeSelectedType case otPackage Session.Output "package selected" set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList for each element in package.Elements Session.Output "element type " + element.MetaType + " found!" if element.MetaType = "eTOM Process" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "custom", false end if next
case otElement Session.Output "element selected" dim theElement as EA.Element set theElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Session.Output "element " + theElement.Name + " found!" if theElement.MetaType = "eTOM Process" then Session.Output "Element "+ theElement.Name + " found" createNestedHierarchyDiagram theElement, levelList, "custom", false end if
case else Session.Prompt "This script support items of type package.", promptOK end select Session.Output "done" end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test("{B8FDEF86-54B6-4964-B33D-2A7783432493}")
sub Test(packageGUID) dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element Session.Output "starting" set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "Process" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if next end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 2 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level1.objectHeight = 120 level1.objectWidth = 200 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20
level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 12 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 4 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level2.objectHeight = 80 level2.objectWidth = 150 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 50 level2.vertSpace = 10
level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 9 levellist.add 2, level2 set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
set level3 = new hierarchylevel
level3.numobjects = 4 level3.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level3.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level3.objectHeight = 55 level3.objectWidth = 120 level3.horizOffset = 10 level3.horizSpace = 10 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 10
level3.objectstyle.fillcolor = colorWhite level3.objectstyle.fontname = "Calibri" level3.objectstyle.fontsize = 8 levellist.add 3, level3 set getDiagramLevelList = levelList end function

sub OnProjectBrowserScript()

treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "Create Process diagram....starting..." select case treeSelectedType case otPackage set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList ' for each element in package.Elements ' Session.Output "element type " + element.MetaType + " found!" ' for each subElement in element.Elements ' if subElement.MetaType = "TMF DMM Dimension" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram package, levelList, "eTOM", false ''params: parentItem, levelList, diagramType, openDiagram ' end if ' next ' next case else Session.Prompt "This script support items of type package.", promptOK end select Session.Output "Done!" end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test "{66A70E55-2B99-4e54-8893-B0D7224818DD}"
sub Test(packageGUID)
dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList for each element in package.Elements
