Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Import File Attributes from CSV" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
Option Explicit !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC EAScriptLib.VBScript-Dialog
' Script Name: ImportAttributesFromCSV ' Author: David Anderson ' Purpose: Import Attributes from a Slected CSV file into a selcted diagram object ' Where the CSV file has the following 4 columns ' 1. Attribute Name ' 2. Type ' 3. Stereotype ' 4. Notes ' ' Date: July-02-2017 ' Change Log: ' Dec-01-2017: Changed to select object from a diagram ' Add prompt for the delimiter ' Default delimiter set to |
Sub ImportAttributesFromCSV() Dim strFile Dim strFileType Dim fileSystemObject dim inputFile dim thisFile dim strFileName
' Show the script output window Repository.EnsureOutputVisible "Script" dim currentDiagram as EA.Diagram set currentDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram()
if not currentDiagram is nothing then dim selectedObjects as EA.Collection set selectedObjects = currentDiagram.SelectedObjects
if selectedObjects.Count = 1 then dim selectedObject as EA.DiagramObject dim theElement as EA.Element Dim theDelimiter theDelimiter = DLGInputBox( "Enter delimiter", "Attribute Import", "|" )
for each selectedObject in selectedObjects set theElement = Repository.GetElementByID(selectedObject.ElementID) if not theElement is nothing and theElement.ObjectType = otElement then strFile = SelectFile( ) If strFile = "" Then Session.Output("No file selected." ) stop Else Session.Output("""" & strFile & """") End If ' Define Global File IO Objects set fileSystemObject = CreateObject( "Scripting.FileSystemObject" ) set inputFile = fileSystemObject.GetFile(strFile) strFileName = fileSystemObject.getfileName(inputFile) 'check file type strFileType=Ucase(Right(strFile,3)) Select Case strFileType Case "CSV" Session.Output("CSV File Type OK") Case else Session.Output("File Type not yet supported") End Select
'read first row dim strRow set inputFile = fileSystemObject.OpenTextFile(strFile) strRow = inputFile.readline 'check it is a CSV header row... dim cols cols=Split(strRow, theDelimiter) if Ubound(Cols) = 3 and _ cols(0) = "Attribute Name" and _ cols(1) = "Type" and _ cols(2) = "Stereotype" and _ cols(3) = "Notes" then Session.Output("CSV File looks good") else Session.Output("CSV File does not look good") end if
dim attributes as EA.Collection set attributes = theElement.Attributes dim newAttribute as EA.Attribute dim strCols dim i
'if attribute already exist.. delete them for i = 0 to attributes.Count - 1 Dim currentAttribute as EA.Attribute set currentAttribute = attributes.GetAt( i ) Session.Output( "Deleting Attribute: " & currentAttribute.Name ) attributes.DeleteAt i, false next do until inputFile.AtEndOfStream strRow = inputFile.readline strCols = split(strRow, theDelimiter) 'add attributes set newAttribute = attributes.AddNew(strCols(0), strCols(1)) newAttribute.Stereotype=strCols(2) newAttribute.Notes=strCols(3) newAttribute.Update() attributes.Refresh() Session.Output( "Added attribute: " & newAttribute.Name & _ "(Type=" & newAttribute.Type & "Sterotype=" & newattribute.stereotype & "Notes=" & newAttribute.Notes & ")" ) loop
inputFile.Close Session.Output("Done.." ) end if next else ' Nothing is selected end if
ReloadDiagram(currentDiagram.DiagramID)
else Session.Prompt "This script requires a diagram to be visible", promptOK end if End Sub ImportAttributesFromCSV
Function SelectFile( ) ' File Browser via HTA ' Author: Rudi Degrande, modifications by Denis St-Pierre and Rob van der Woude ' Features: Works in Windows Vista and up (Should also work in XP). ' Fairly fast. ' All native code/controls (No 3rd party DLL/ XP DLL). ' Caveats: Cannot define default starting folder. ' Uses last folder used with MSHTA.EXE stored in Binary in [HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\ComDlg32]. ' Dialog title says "Choose file to upload". ' Source: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/scriptcenter/en-US/a3b358e8-15ae-4ba3-bca5-ec349df65ef6/windows7-vbscript-open-file-dialog-box-fakepath?forum=ITCG Dim objExec, strMSHTA, wshShell SelectFile = "" ' For use in HTAs as well as "plain" VBScript: strMSHTA = "mshta.exe ""about:" & "<" & "input type=file id=FILE>" _ & "<" & "script>FILE.click();new ActiveXObject('Scripting.FileSystemObject')" _ & ".GetStandardStream(1).WriteLine(FILE.value);close();resizeTo(0,0);" & "<" & "/script>""" ' For use in "plain" VBScript only: ' strMSHTA = "mshta.exe ""about:<input type=file id=FILE>" _ ' & "<script>FILE.click();new ActiveXObject('Scripting.FileSystemObject')" _ ' & ".GetStandardStream(1).WriteLine(FILE.value);close();resizeTo(0,0);</script>""" Set wshShell = CreateObject( "WScript.Shell" ) Set objExec = wshShell.Exec( strMSHTA ) SelectFile = objExec.StdOut.ReadLine( ) Set objExec = Nothing Set wshShell = Nothing End Function

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Export PlantUML Script" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC EAScriptLib.VBScript-Logging
'LOGLEVEL=0 'ERROR LOGLEVEL=1 'INFO 'LOGLEVEL=2 'WARNING 'LOGLEVEL=3 'DEBUG 'LOGLEVEL=4 'TRACE ' ' Script Name: ExportPlantUMLscript ' Author: David Anderson ' Purpose: Create a PUML file from the Selected Note Element ' Date: 25-Mar-2019 ' dim currentDiagram as EA.Diagram dim currentPackage as EA.Package
sub OnDiagramScript() 'Show the script output window Repository.EnsureOutputVisible "Script" call LOGInfo ("------VBScript Export PlantUML Script------" )
' Get a reference to the current diagram set currentDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram() set currentPackage = Repository.GetPackageByID(currentDiagram.PackageID) dim selectedObjects as EA.Collection set selectedObjects = currentDiagram.SelectedObjects dim diagramObject as EA.DiagramObject dim element as EA.Element if selectedObjects.Count = 1 then Dim theSelectedElement as EA.Element Dim selectedObject as EA.DiagramObject set selectedObject = selectedObjects.GetAt (0) set theSelectedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(selectedObject.ElementID) 'check a note element is selected if not theSelectedElement is nothing _ and theSelectedElement.ObjectType = otElement _ and theSelectedElement.Type = "Note" then dim PlantUMLfn dim project set project = Repository.GetProjectInterface() dim OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT = &H2 PlantUMLfn = project.GetFileNameDialog (currentDiagram.Name & ".puml", "PlantUML Files|*.pu;*.puml", 1, OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT ,"", 1) If PlantUMLfn = "" Then call LOGInfo("File not selected" ) stop Else call LOGInfo ("PlantUML Script file selected: " & PlantUMLfn ) Dim fileSystemObject dim outputFile call LOGDebug("""" & PlantUMLfn & """") ' Define Global File IO Objects set fileSystemObject = CreateObject( "Scripting.FileSystemObject" ) dim strRow If fileSystemObject.FileExists(PlantUMLfn) Then Set outputFile = fileSystemObject.OpenTextFile(PlantUMLfn, 2, True) Else Set outputFile = fileSystemObject.CreateTextFile(PlantUMLfn, True) End If strRow = Split(theSelectedElement.Notes,vbcrlf,-1,0) dim i for i = 0 to ubound(strRow) outputFile.writeline (strRow(i)) call LOGDebug(strRow(i)) next outputFile.Close End If else Session.Prompt "A note object should be selected" , promptOK end if else if selectedObjects.Count = 0 then ' Nothing is selected Session.Prompt "A note object should be selected" , promptOK else Session.Prompt "Only one object should be selected" , promptOK end if end if
call LOGInfo ( "Script Complete" ) call LOGInfo ( "===============" )
end sub
OnDiagramScript

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Run PlantUML Script" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC Common.Print-Array !INC Common.color-picker !INC EAScriptLib.VBScript-Logging !INC PlantUML.Create-Activity-Diagram !INC PlantUML.Create-Class-Diagram !INC PlantUML.Create-Component-Diagram !INC PlantUML.Create-Deployment-Diagram !INC PlantUML.Create-Sequence-Diagram !INC PlantUML.Create-UseCase-Diagram !INC PlantUML.Create-C4-Diagram
'LOGLEVEL=0 'ERROR 'LOGLEVEL=1 'INFO LOGLEVEL=2 'WARNING 'LOGLEVEL=3 'DEBUG 'LOGLEVEL=4 'TRACE ' ' Script Name: Run PlantUML Script ' Author: David Anderson ' Purpose: Wrapper script to appear in the Diagram Scripting group ' responsible for directing to the relevant script by diagram type. ' Date: 11-March-2019 ' ' 25-Sept-2022: Support C4 Diagrams ' Dim currentDiagram as EA.Diagram Dim currentPackage as EA.Package Dim selectedObject as EA.DiagramObject Dim theSelectedElement as EA.Element
dim layout_array (99, 7) 'store cooridinates of all sequences and fragments that needs to be positioned dim l 'layout array index
sub OnDiagramScript() 'Show the script output window Repository.EnsureOutputVisible "Script" call LOGInfo ("------VBScript Run PlantUML script------" )
' Get a reference to the current diagram set currentDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram() set currentPackage = Repository.GetPackageByID(currentDiagram.PackageID)
if not currentDiagram is nothing then dim selectedObjects as EA.Collection set selectedObjects = currentDiagram.SelectedObjects if selectedObjects.Count = 1 then set selectedObject = selectedObjects.GetAt (0) set theSelectedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(selectedObject.ElementID) ' One or more diagram objects are selected if not theSelectedElement is nothing _ and theSelectedElement.ObjectType = otElement _ and theSelectedElement.Type = "Note" then select case currentDiagram.Type case "Activity" call CreateActivityDiagram () case "Logical" call CreateClassDiagram () case "Component" call CreateComponentDiagram () case "Deployment" call CreateDeploymentDiagram () case "Sequence" call CreateSequenceDiagram () case "Use Case" call CreateUseCaseDiagram () case else call LOGWarning("This script does not yet support " & currentDiagram.Type & " diagrams") end select call LOGInfo ( "Script Complete" ) call LOGInfo ( "===============" ) Session.Prompt "Done" , promptOK else Session.Prompt "A note object with the valid PlantUML script should be selected" , promptOK end if else if selectedObjects.Count = 0 then ' Nothing is selected Session.Prompt "A note object with the valid PlantUML script should be selected" , promptOK else Session.Prompt "Only one object should be selected" , promptOK end if end if else Session.Prompt "This script requires a diagram to be visible", promptOK end if
end sub
OnDiagramScript

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="Model Management Utilities" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' Original Model Management Utility ' Purpose: General manipulation of model elements ' Last Update: 2025-08-26
'****************************************** 'CONNECTORS '******************************************
' copy properties of one connector to another existing connector function copyConnector(sourceConnector, targetConnector) targetConnector.Name = sourceConnector.Name targetConnector.Direction = sourceConnector.Direction targetConnector.Notes = sourceConnector.Notes targetConnector.Update end function
function copyConnectorEnd(sourceConEnd, targetConEnd) targetConEnd.Aggregation = sourceConEnd.Aggregation targetConEnd.Navigable = sourceConEnd.Navigable targetConEnd.Cardinality = sourceConEnd.Cardinality targetConEnd.Update end function
function getConnectorEndLowerBound(connectorEnd) dim bounds ' as string if connectorEnd.Cardinality <> "" then bounds = Split(connectorEnd.Cardinality, "..") getConnectorEndLowerBound = bounds(0) else getConnectorEndLowerBound = 0 end if end function
function getConnectorEndUpperBound(connectorEnd) dim bounds ' as string if connectorEnd.Cardinality <> "" then bounds = Split(connectorEnd.Cardinality, "..") if UBound(bounds) = 0 then getConnectorEndUpperBound = bounds(0) elseif UBound(bounds) = 1 then getConnectorEndUpperBound = bounds(1) end if else getConnectorEndUpperBound = 1 end if end function
' returns the guid of elements which have connectors navigable from the source function getNavigableElements(element, connectorMetaType, relatedElementType) dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element
set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "Scripting.Dictionary") 'Session.Output element.Name & " element.Connectors.Count = " & element.Connectors.Count
for each connector in element.Connectors 'Session.Output "connector.Type = " & connector.Type 'Session.Output "connector.MetaType = " & connector.MetaType
if connector.MetaType = connectorMetaType then sourceClient = connector.ClientID = element.ElementID and connector.SupplierEnd.Navigable <> "Non-Navigable" sourceSupplier = connector.SupplierID = element.ElementID and connector.ClientEnd.Navigable <> "Non-Navigable" if sourceClient or sourceSupplier then relatedElementID = connector.SupplierID set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID) 'Session.Output "relatedElementID = " & relatedElementID 'Session.Output "relatedElement.Name = " & relatedElement.Name 'Session.Output "relatedElement.MetaType = " & relatedElement.MetaType if relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType then relatedElementList.Add relatedElement.ElementGUID, relatedElement end if end if end if next set getNavigableElements = relatedElementList
end function
' returns the guid of connectors which have connectors navigable from the source function getNavigableConnectors(element, connectorMetaType, relatedElementType) dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element dim navigableConnector ' as boolean dim sourceClient dim sourceSupplier
set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "Scripting.Dictionary") Session.Output element.Name & " element.Connectors.Count = " & element.Connectors.Count
for each connector in element.Connectors Session.Output "connector.Type = " & connector.Type Session.Output "connector.MetaType = " & connector.MetaType
if connector.MetaType = connectorMetaType then sourceClient = connector.ClientID = element.ElementID and connector.SupplierEnd.Navigable <> "Non-Navigable" sourceSupplier = connector.SupplierID = element.ElementID and connector.ClientEnd.Navigable <> "Non-Navigable" navigableConnector = sourceClient or sourceSupplier if sourceClient then set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(connector.SupplierID) elseif sourceSupplier then set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(connector.ClientID) end if 'Session.Output "relatedElementID = " & relatedElementID 'Session.Output "relatedElement.Name = " & relatedElement.Name 'Session.Output "relatedElement.MetaType = " & relatedElement.MetaType if navigableConnector then if relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType then relatedElementList.Add connector.ConnectorGUID, connector end if end if end if next set getNavigableConnectors = relatedElementList
end function
' returns the first related element on a list function getRelatedSupplierElement( element, connectorMetaType, relatedElementMetaType)
dim relatedElementList ' as Scripting.Dictionary dim relatedElementArray ' as Element() set relatedElementList = getRelatedSupplierElementList( element, connectorMetaType, relatedElementMetaType)
if relatedElementList.Count > 0 then relatedElementArray = relatedElementList.Items set getRelatedSupplierElement = relatedElementArray(0) else set getRelatedSupplierElement = nothing end if end function
' returns the first related element on a list by element, connector.MetaType, connector.Stereotype, relatedElement.MetaType, related.ElementStereotype function getRelatedSupplierElement2( element, connectorMetaType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementMetaType, relatedElementStereotype)
dim relatedElementList ' as Scripting.Dictionary dim relatedElementArray ' as Element() set relatedElementList = getRelatedSupplierElementList2( element, connectorMetaType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementMetaType, relatedElementStereotype)
if relatedElementList.Count > 0 then relatedElementArray = relatedElementList.Items set getRelatedSupplierElement2 = relatedElementArray(0) else set getRelatedSupplierElement2 = nothing end if
end function
' returns a list of related elements function getRelatedSupplierElementList( element, connectorMetaType, relatedElementMetaType)
dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element
set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "Scripting.Dictionary") 'Session.Output element.Name & " element.Connectors.Count = " & element.Connectors.Count
for each connector in element.Connectors 'Session.Output "connector.Type = " & connector.Type 'Session.Output "connector.MetaType = " & connector.MetaType
if connector.MetaType = connectorMetaType then if connector.ClientID = element.ElementID then relatedElementID = connector.SupplierID set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID) 'Session.Output "relatedElementID = " & relatedElementID 'Session.Output "relatedElement.Name = " & relatedElement.Name 'Session.Output "relatedElement.MetaType = " & relatedElement.MetaType if relatedElement.MetaType = relatedElementMetaType then relatedElementList.Add relatedElement.ElementGUID, relatedElement end if end if end if next set getRelatedSupplierElementList = relatedElementList
end function
' returns a list of related elements by by element, connector.MetaType, connector.Stereotype, relatedElement.MetaType, related.ElementStereotype function getRelatedSupplierElementList2( element, connectorType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementType, relatedElementStereotype)
dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "Scripting.Dictionary")
for each connector in element.Connectors if connector.Type = connectorType then if IsNull(connectorStereotype) or connector.Stereotype = connectorStereotype then if connector.ClientID = element.ElementID then relatedElementID = connector.SupplierID set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID) if relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType then if IsNull( relatedElementStereotype) or relatedElement.Stereotype = relatedElementStereotype then relatedElementList.Add relatedElement.ElementGUID, relatedElement end if end if end if end if end if next set getRelatedSupplierElementList2 = relatedElementList end function
' returns a list of related elements by the connector meta type and the generic type of the related element and the navigability function getRelatedSupplierElementList3(element, connectorMetaType, relatedElementType, navigability)
dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element
set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "Scripting.Dictionary") 'Session.Output element.Name & " element.Connectors.Count = " & element.Connectors.Count
for each connector in element.Connectors 'Session.Output "connector.Type = " & connector.Type 'Session.Output "connector.MetaType = " & connector.MetaType
if connector.MetaType = connectorMetaType then if connector.ClientID = element.ElementID and connector.SupplierEnd.Navigable = navigability then relatedElementID = connector.SupplierID set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID) 'Session.Output "relatedElementID = " & relatedElementID 'Session.Output "relatedElement.Name = " & relatedElement.Name 'Session.Output "relatedElement.MetaType = " & relatedElement.MetaType if relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType then relatedElementList.Add relatedElement.ElementGUID, relatedElement end if end if end if next set getRelatedSupplierElementList3 = relatedElementList
end function
' returns a list of related client elements by the connector meta type and the generic type of the related element and the navigability function getRelatedClientElementList(element, connectorMetaType, relatedElementType, navigability)
dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element
set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "Scripting.Dictionary") 'Session.Output element.Name & " element.Connectors.Count = " & element.Connectors.Count
for each connector in element.Connectors 'Session.Output "connector.Type = " & connector.Type 'Session.Output "connector.MetaType = " & connector.MetaType
if connector.MetaType = connectorMetaType then if connector.SupplierID = element.ElementID and connector.ClientEnd.Navigable = navigability then relatedElementID = connector.ClientID set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID) 'Session.Output "relatedElementID = " & relatedElementID 'Session.Output "relatedElement.Name = " & relatedElement.Name 'Session.Output "relatedElement.MetaType = " & relatedElement.MetaType if relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType then relatedElementList.Add relatedElement.ElementGUID, relatedElement end if end if end if next set getRelatedClientElementList = relatedElementList
end function
''getRelatedElement, aims to retrieve a specific related element from a given element '' based on a certain relationship defined by connector type and stereotype, '' and the meta-type and stereotype of the related element function getRelatedElement( element, connectorMetaType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementMetaType, relatedElementStereotype)
dim relatedElementList ' as Scripting.Dictionary dim relatedElementArray ' as Element() set relatedElementList = getRelatedElementList2( element, connectorMetaType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementMetaType, relatedElementStereotype) if relatedElementList.Count > 0 then relatedElementArray = relatedElementList.Items set getRelatedElement = relatedElementArray(0) else set getRelatedElement = nothing end if
end function
function getRelatedElementList2 ( element, connectorType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementType, relatedElementStereotype)
dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "Scripting.Dictionary")
for each connector in element.Connectors
if connector.Type = connectorType then if IsNull(connectorStereotype) or connector.Stereotype = connectorStereotype then if connector.ClientID = element.ElementID then relatedElementID = connector.SupplierID else relatedElementID = connector.ClientID end if set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID) if relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType then if IsNull( relatedElementStereotype) or relatedElement.Stereotype = relatedElementStereotype then relatedElementList.Add relatedElement.ElementGUID, relatedElement end if end if end if end if next set getRelatedElementList = relatedElementList end function
' Purpose: Return a dictionary of related elements while safely handling duplicate keys ' (avoids "This key is already associated with an element of this collection").
Function getRelatedElementList( element, connectorType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementType, relatedElementStereotype)
Dim connector As EA.Connector Dim relatedElementList Dim relatedElementID Dim relatedElement As EA.Element Dim key
Set relatedElementList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
For Each connector In element.Connectors
If connector.Type = connectorType Then If IsNull(connectorStereotype) Or connector.Stereotype = connectorStereotype Then
If connector.ClientID = element.ElementID Then relatedElementID = connector.SupplierID Else relatedElementID = connector.ClientID End If
Set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID)
If Not relatedElement Is Nothing Then If relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType Then If IsNull(relatedElementStereotype) Or relatedElement.Stereotype = relatedElementStereotype Then
key = relatedElement.ElementGUID
' Safe add: skip duplicates; still guard with On Error in case of edge cases If Not relatedElementList.Exists(key) Then On Error Resume Next relatedElementList.Add key, relatedElement If Err.Number <> 0 Then Session.Output "getRelatedElementList: duplicate or add error for GUID=" & key & _ " continuing. Err=" & Err.Number & " " & Err.Description Err.Clear End If On Error GoTo 0 Else ' Duplicate key detected log and continue Session.Output "getRelatedElementList: duplicate GUID skipped: " & key End If
End If End If End If
End If End If Next
Set getRelatedElementList = relatedElementList
End Function
' returns a list of elements sorted by name function getSortedRelatedElementList( element, connectorType, connectorStereotype, relatedElementType, relatedElementStereotype)
dim connector as EA.Connector dim relatedElementList dim relatedElementID dim relatedElement as EA.Element set relatedElementList = CreateObject( "System.Collections.SortedList")
for each connector in element.Connectors if connector.Type = connectorType then if IsNull(connectorStereotype) or connector.Stereotype = connectorStereotype then if connector.ClientID = element.ElementID then relatedElementID = connector.SupplierID else relatedElementID = connector.ClientID end if set relatedElement = Repository.GetElementByID(relatedElementID) if relatedElement.Type = relatedElementType then if IsNull( relatedElementStereotype) or relatedElement.Stereotype = relatedElementStereotype then relatedElementList.Add relatedElement.Name, relatedElement end if end if end if end if next set getSortedRelatedElementList = relatedElementList end function
'add a connector of connType, connStereotype to 2 elements ' use addConnectorMDG fpr stereotyped connectors part of a MDG function addConnector( fromElement, connType, connStereotype, toElement)
dim newConnector as EA.Connector Session.Output "- Creating new " & connStereotype & " " & connType & " relationship from " & fromElement.Name & " to " & toElement.Name & "..." set newConnector = fromElement.Connectors.AddNew("", connType) newConnector.Stereotype = connStereotype newConnector.SupplierID = toElement.ElementID newConnector.Update fromElement.Connectors.Refresh set addConnector = newConnector end function
'add a MDG stereotyped connector , connStereotype to 2 elements function addConnectorMDG( fromElement, connType, connStereotype, toElement)
dim newConnector as EA.Connector Session.Output "- Creating new " & connStereotype & " " & connType & " relationship from " & fromElement.Name & " to " & toElement.Name & "..." set newConnector = fromElement.Connectors.AddNew("", connType) newConnector.StereotypeEx = connStereotype newConnector.SupplierID = toElement.ElementID newConnector.Update fromElement.Connectors.Refresh set addConnectorMDG = newConnector end function
'****************************************** 'Elements '******************************************
' Search for an object by name, stereotype and Type and returns the first in the list function lookupElement(lookupValue, lookupStereotype, lookupElementType)
dim sqlString ' As String dim elementList_XML ' As String dim elementList_XMLDoc ' As Xml.XmlDocument dim element_XMLNodeList ' As Xml.XmlNodeList dim element_XMLNode ' As Xml.XmlNode dim elementGUID ' As String dim lookupColumnName ' As String
sqlString = "SELECT ea_guid FROM t_object" sqlString = sqlString & " WHERE t_object.Name = '" & lookupValue & "'"
If lookupStereotype = vbNullString Then sqlString = sqlString & " AND t_object.Stereotype Is Null" Else sqlString = sqlString & " AND t_object.Stereotype = '" & lookupStereotype & "'" End If
sqlString = sqlString & " AND t_object.Object_Type = '" & lookupElementType & "'" elementList_XML = Repository.SQLQuery(sqlString) set elementList_XMLDoc = CreateObject("Microsoft.XMLDOM") elementList_XMLDoc.LoadXml(elementList_XML) set element_XMLNodeList = elementList_XMLDoc.SelectNodes("/EADATA/Dataset_0/Data/Row")
If element_XMLNodeList.Length > 0 Then set element_XMLNode = element_XMLNodeList.Item(0) elementGUID = element_XMLNode.FirstChild.Text set lookupElement = Repository.GetElementByGuid(elementGUID) Else set lookupElement = Nothing End If end function
'returns an ArrayList with the elements accordin tot he ObjectID's in the given query function getElementsFromQuery(sqlQuery) dim elements set elements = Repository.GetElementSet(sqlQuery,2) dim result set result = CreateObject("System.Collections.ArrayList") dim element for each element in elements result.Add Element next set getElementsFromQuery = result end function
' Delete an element sub deleteElement( elementToDelete) dim packageID ' as Integer dim package as EA.Package dim element as EA.Element dim elementIndex ' as Integer
packageID = elementToDelete.PackageID set package = Repository.GetPackageByID( packageID) elementIndex = 0
for each element in package.Elements if element.ElementID = elementToDelete.ElementID then package.Elements.Delete(elementIndex) exit for end if elementIndex = elementIndex + 1 next package.Elements.Refresh
end sub
'****************************************** ' Method '****************************************** ' Function to create HTTP types of stereotyped operations (List, Retrieve, Create, Patch, Delete) for an element ' Parameters: ' - element: The element for which operations are to be created ' - methodName: The name of the method from which to derive operation names ' - methodStereotype: The stereotype to be applied to the operations Sub CreateStereotypedOperation(element, methodName, methodStereotype) Dim operationTypes(5) operationTypes(0) = "List" operationTypes(1) = "Retrieve" operationTypes(2) = "Create" operationTypes(3) = "Patch" operationTypes(4) = "Delete"
Dim httpMethods(5) httpMethods(0) = "get" httpMethods(1) = "get" httpMethods(2) = "post" httpMethods(3) = "patch" httpMethods(4) = "delete"
Dim i
For i = 0 To UBound(operationTypes) Dim operationName operationName = operationTypes(i) & methodName.Name
' Check if operation already exists Dim existingOperation Set existingOperation = FindOperation(element, operationName) If IsNull(existingOperation) Then ' Create Operation with name and stereotype Dim newOperation Set newOperation = element.Methods.AddNew(operationName, methodName.Name) newOperation.StereotypeEx = methodStereotype newOperation.Name = operationName newOperation.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID
' Update method newOperation.Update
' Set tagged values SetTaggedValueValue2 newOperation, "hTTPMethod", httpMethods(i) SetTaggedValueValue2 newOperation, "tags", "TODO" SetTaggedValueValue2 newOperation, "summary", "TODO" SetTaggedValueValue2 newOperation, "relativePath", "/" & methodName.Name
' Set parameters for Create and Patch operations If operationTypes(i) = "Create" Or operationTypes(i) = "Patch" Then Dim param Set param = newOperation.Parameters.AddNew(methodName.Name, methodName.Name) param.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID param.Update newOperation.Parameters.Refresh End If Else Session.Output "Duplicate found (" & operationName & " Operation)" End If Next
' Refresh element element.Methods.Refresh element.Update element.Refresh End Sub
' Function to find an operation in the element's methods ' Parameters: ' - element: The element in which to search for the operation ' - operationName: The name of the operation to find ' Returns: ' - EA.Method: The found operation if exists, otherwise null Function FindOperation(element, operationName) Dim operation For Each operation In element.Methods If operation.Name = operationName Then Set FindOperation = operation Exit Function End If Next Set FindOperation = Nothing End Function
function CreateOperation (element, methodName, methodStereotype) dim i 'as string
dim listOp as EA.Method 'dim listParam as EA.Parameter dim retreiveOp as EA.Method dim retreiveParam as EA.Parameter dim createOp as EA.Method dim createParam as EA.Parameter dim patchOp as EA.Method dim patchParam as EA.Parameter dim deleteOp as EA.Method dim deleteParam as EA.Parameter
' check if operation already exists for each listOp in element.Methods if listOp.Name = "List" & methodName.name then i = 1 Session.Output "Duplicate found (List Operation)" end if next if i = 0 then ' create List Operation with name, and stereotype set listOp = element.Methods.AddNew ("List" & methodName.name, methodName.name) listOp.StereotypeEx = methodStereotype listOp.Name = "List" & methodName.name listOp.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID ' update method listOp.Update ' set Tagged Value setTaggedValueValue2 listOp, "hTTPMethod", "get" setTaggedValueValue2 listOp, "tags", methodName.name setTaggedValueValue2 listOp, "summary", "Retrieves a list of all "&methodName.Name setTaggedValueValue2 listOp, "relativePath", "/" & methodName.Name '' set Parameters ' set listParam = listOp.Parameters.AddNew (methodName.name, methodName.name) ' listParam.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID ' listParam.Update ' listOp.Parameters.Refresh end if i = 0
' check if operation already exists for each retreiveOp in element.Methods if retreiveOp.Name = "Retreive" & methodName.name then i = 1 Session.Output "Duplicate found (Retreive Operation)" end if next if i = 0 then ' create Retreive Operation with name, and stereotype set retreiveOp = element.Methods.AddNew ("Retreive" & methodName.name, methodName.name) retreiveOp.StereotypeEx = methodStereotype retreiveOp.Name = "Retreive" & methodName.name retreiveOp.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID ' update method retreiveOp.Update ' set tagged value setTaggedValueValue2 retreiveOp, "hTTPMethod", "get" setTaggedValueValue2 retreiveOp, "tags", methodName.name setTaggedValueValue2 retreiveOp, "summary", "retrieve an existing "&methodName.name&" record based on the provided ID." setTaggedValueValue2 retreiveOp, "relativePath", "/" & methodName.Name & "/{id}" ' set parameter set retreiveParam = retreiveOp.Parameters.AddNew ("id", "string") retreiveParam.Update retreiveOp.Parameters.Refresh end if i = 0
' check if operation already exists for each createOp in element.Methods if createOp.Name = "Create" & methodName.name then i = 1 Session.Output "Duplicate found (Create Operation)" end if next if i = 0 then ' create Create Operation with name, and stereotype set createOp = element.Methods.AddNew ("Create" & methodName.name, methodName.name) createOp.StereotypeEx = methodStereotype createOp.Name = "Create" & methodName.name createOp.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID ' update method createOp.Update ' set Tagged Value setTaggedValueValue2 createOp, "hTTPMethod", "post" setTaggedValueValue2 createOp, "tags", methodName.name setTaggedValueValue2 createOp, "summary", "Creates a new "&methodName.name&" record." setTaggedValueValue2 createOp, "relativePath", "/" & methodName.Name ' set parameter set createParam = createOp.Parameters.AddNew (methodName.name, methodName.name) createParam.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID createParam.update createOp.Parameters.Refresh
end if i = 0
' check if operation already exists for each patchOp in element.Methods if patchOp.Name = "Patch" & methodName.name then i = 1 Session.Output "Duplicate found (Patch Operation)" end if next if i = 0 then ' create Patch Operation with name, and stereotype set patchOp = element.Methods.AddNew ("Patch" & methodName.name, methodName.name) patchOp.StereotypeEx = methodStereotype patchOp.Name = "Patch" & methodName.name patchOp.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID ' update method patchOp.Update ' set Tagged Value setTaggedValueValue2 patchOp, "hTTPMethod", "patch" setTaggedValueValue2 patchOp, "tags", methodName.name setTaggedValueValue2 patchOp, "summary", "Updates an existing "&methodName.name&" record." setTaggedValueValue2 patchOp, "relativePath", "/" & methodName.Name ' set parameter set patchParam = patchOp.Parameters.AddNew (methodName.name, methodName.name) patchParam.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID patchParam.Update patchOp.Parameters.Refresh end if i = 0
' check if operation already exists for each deleteOp in element.Methods if deleteOp.Name = "Delete" & methodName.name then i = 1 Session.Output "Duplicate found (Delete Operation)" end if next if i = 0 then ' create Delete Operation with name, and stereotype set deleteOp = element.Methods.AddNew ("Delete" & methodName.name, methodName.name) deleteOp.StereotypeEx = methodStereotype deleteOp.Name = "Delete" & methodName.name deleteOp.ClassifierID = methodName.ElementID 'update method deleteOp.Update ' set tagged value setTaggedValueValue2 deleteOp, "hTTPMethod", "delete" setTaggedValueValue2 deleteOp, "tags", methodName.name setTaggedValueValue2 deleteOp, "summary", "Deletes an existing "&methodName.name&" record based on the provided ID." setTaggedValueValue2 deleteOp, "relativePath", "/" & methodName.Name ' set parameter set deleteParam = deleteOp.Parameters.AddNew ("id", "string") deleteParam.Update deleteOp.Parameters.Refresh end if i = 0
' refresh element element.Methods.Refresh element.Update element.Refresh
end Function
'****************************************** ' Method Parameters ' ' This function GetParameterNames iterates through the parameters of the provided EA.Method aMethod, ' concatenates their names into a string variable paramNames, and separates them by commas. ' Finally, it returns the concatenated string containing the parameter names. ' You can use this function by passing the method object and storing the returned string variable for further processing or output. '****************************************** Function GetParameterNames(aMethod) Dim parameters Set parameters = aMethod.Parameters
Dim paramNames paramNames = ""
Dim i For i = 0 To parameters.Count - 1 Dim currentParameter Set currentParameter = parameters.GetAt(i)
' Append parameter name to the string variable paramNames = paramNames & currentParameter.Type
' Add comma if it's not the last parameter If i < parameters.Count - 1 Then paramNames = paramNames & ", " End If Next
' Return the parameter names as a string GetParameterNames = paramNames End Function
'****************************************** ' Attributes '****************************************** ' Add an attribute to an element, including the initial value function setAttribute( element, attributeName, defaultValue)
dim attribute as EA.Attribute dim attributeExists 'as Boolean attributeExists = false
for each attribute in element.Attributes if attribute.Name = attributeName then ' attribute found attributeExists = true exit for end if next if not attributeExists then set attribute = element.Attributes.AddNew( attributeName, "") element.Attributes.Refresh end if attribute.Default = defaultValue attribute.Update set setAttribute = attribute end function
'' add to the Elelment element the Attribute sourceAttribute sub copyAttribute( element, sourceAttribute)
dim attribute as EA.Attribute dim attributeExists 'as Boolean attributeExists = false
for each attribute in element.Attributes if attribute.Name = sourceAttribute.Name then attributeExists = true exit for end if next if not attributeExists then set attribute = element.Attributes.AddNew( sourceAttribute.Name, "") element.Attributes.Refresh end if attribute.Default = sourceAttribute.Default attribute.Type = sourceAttribute.Type attribute.ClassifierID = sourceAttribute.ClassifierID attribute.Notes = sourceAttribute.Notes attribute.Update end sub
sub setElementPDATA(element, pdataIndex, pdataValue) 'PDATA1 ' For Package elements: primary key of the package ' For Elements: Same as the Status column ' For Parts/Instances: GUID of the classifier ' For UseCase: #EXP#=<ep>; semi-colon separated list of Extension Points <ep> ' For Notes: linked element feature name ' For Text displaying as hyperlink: t_diagram.Diagram_ID ' For Requirements: Status property ' For UMLDiagram: Diagram_ID of the underlying diagram; ' If Object_Type is one of Activity, Artifact, Class, Interaction, Requirement, State, 'StateMachine, UseCase (and probably some more) and NType is 8 and PDATA1 has a number 'greater then zero then PDATA1 corresponds to t_diagram.Diagram_ID of the composite 'diagram. 'if NType is 82 diagram hyperlink; PDATA1 == t_diagram.Diagram_ID ' ' PDATA2 ' For Elements: Same as the Priority column ' For Notes: Object_ID of the linked feature element ' For Requirements: Priority property
' PDATA3 ' For Elements: Same as the Difficulty column ' For Notes: Reference name into the linked feature element ' For Ports in classified Parts: the GUID of the corresponding Port in the Classifier. ' For State: t_diagram.Diagram_ID of the composite diagram ' For Requirements: Difficulty property
' PDATA4 ' For Note elements: Yes if the note is linked to an element feature and idref=<val>; list where <val> is the primary key of the connector(s) to which the note is linked ' For elements: If > 0 this is the primary key of the connector for which this element is defines as association class
' PDATA5 Keywords property
Dim sqlString 'As String Dim pdataColumnName 'As String pdataColumnName = "PDATA" & pdataIndex sqlString = "UPDATE t_object SET " & pdataColumnName & "='" & pdataValue & "' WHERE Object_ID = " & element.ElementID Repository.Execute( sqlString) element.Refresh End Sub
'****************************************** ' TaggedValue '****************************************** ' get the value of a tagged value, inside an element by taggedValue.Name function getTaggedValueValue( eaItem, taggedValueName)
dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue dim taggedValueValue 'as String set taggedValue = eaItem.TaggedValues.GetByName( taggedValueName) if taggedValue is nothing then taggedValueValue = "" else taggedValueValue = taggedValue.Value end if getTaggedValueValue = taggedValueValue end function
'' set the value of a tagged value, inside an element by taggedValue.Name function setTaggedValueValue( eaItem, taggedValueName, taggedValueValue)
dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue on error resume next set taggedValue = eaItem.TaggedValues.GetByName( taggedValueName)
if err.Number <> 0 or taggedValue is nothing then session.output "error on tagValue" set taggedValue = eaItem.TaggedValues.AddNew( taggedValueName, "") err.Clear end if on error goto 0
taggedValue.Value = taggedValueValue taggedValue.Update eaItem.TaggedValues.Refresh end function
function setTaggedValueValue2( eaItem, taggedValueName, taggedValueValue) dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue dim i 'as index
for i = 0 to eaItem.TaggedValues.Count - 1 eaItem.TaggedValues.GetAt(i) if eaItem.TaggedValues.GetAt(i).Name = taggedValueName then set taggedValue = eaItem.TaggedValues.GetAt(i) taggedValue.Value = taggedValueValue taggedValue.Update eaItem.TaggedValues.Refresh end if next
end function '' set the value of a tagged value, inside an Package by taggedValue.Name sub setTaggedValuePackageValue( eaPackage, taggedValueName, taggedValueValue)
dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue on error resume next set taggedValue = eaPackage.element.TaggedValues.GetByName( taggedValueName)
if err.Number <> 0 or taggedValue is nothing then set taggedValue = eaPackage.element.TaggedValues.AddNew( taggedValueName, "") err.Clear end if on error goto 0
taggedValue.Value = taggedValueValue taggedValue.Update eaPackage.element.TaggedValues.Refresh end sub
'check if a tag with that name already exists, create new one if not found function getExistingOrNewTaggedValue(owner, tagname) dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue dim returnTag as EA.TaggedValue set returnTag = nothing 'check if a tag with that name alrady exists for each taggedValue in owner.TaggedValues if taggedValue.Name = tagName then set returnTag = taggedValue exit for end if next 'create new one if not found if returnTag is nothing then set returnTag = owner.TaggedValues.AddNew(tagname,"") end if 'return set getExistingOrNewTaggedValue = returnTag end function
'' Delete a tagged value, inside an element by taggedValue.Name sub deleteTaggedValue( eaItem, taggedValueName)
dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue dim taggedValueCount 'as Integer dim taggedValueIndex 'as Integer dim deleted 'as Boolean
deleted = false taggedValueCount = eaItem.TaggedValues.Count
for taggedValueIndex = taggedValueCount - 1 to 0 step -1 set taggedValue = eaItem.TaggedValues.GetAt( taggedValueIndex) if taggedValue.Name = taggedValueName then eaItem.TaggedValues.Delete taggedValueIndex deleted = true end if next if deleted then eaItem.TaggedValues.Refresh end if end sub
'' Search an element with a certain Tagged value having a specific value function lookupElementTaggedValue(taggedValueName, lookupValue, lookupStereotype, lookupElementType)
dim sqlString ' As String dim elementList_XML ' As String dim elementList_XMLDoc ' As Xml.XmlDocument dim element_XMLNodeList ' As Xml.XmlNodeList dim element_XMLNode ' As Xml.XmlNode dim elementGUID ' As String dim lookupColumnName ' As String dim lookupElement as EA.Element
sqlString = "SELECT t_object.ea_guid" sqlString = sqlString & " FROM t_object" sqlString = sqlString & " INNER JOIN t_objectproperties ON t_object.Object_ID = t_objectproperties.Object_ID" sqlString = sqlString & " WHERE t_objectproperties.Property = '" & taggedValueName & "'" sqlString = sqlString & " AND t_objectproperties.Value = '" & lookupValue & "'"
If lookupStereotype = vbNullString Then sqlString = sqlString & " AND t_object.Stereotype Is Null" Else sqlString = sqlString & " AND t_object.Stereotype = '" & lookupStereotype & "'" End If sqlString = sqlString & " AND t_object.Object_Type = '" & lookupElementType & "'" elementList_XML = Repository.SQLQuery(sqlString) set elementList_XMLDoc = CreateObject("Microsoft.XMLDOM") elementList_XMLDoc.LoadXml(elementList_XML) set element_XMLNodeList = elementList_XMLDoc.SelectNodes("/EADATA/Dataset_0/Data/Row") If element_XMLNodeList.Length > 0 Then set element_XMLNode = element_XMLNodeList.Item(0) elementGUID = element_XMLNode.FirstChild.Text set lookupElement = Repository.GetElementByGuid(elementGUID) Else set lookupElement = Nothing End If set lookupElementTaggedValue = lookupElement end function
'copies values of the tagged values of the source to the values of the corresponding tagged values at the target function copyTaggedValuesValues (source, target) dim taggedValue as EA.TaggedValue for each taggedValue in source.TaggedValues dim targetTaggedValue as EA.TaggedValue set targetTaggedValue = target.TaggedValues.GetByName(taggedValue.Name) if not targetTaggedValue is nothing then targetTaggedValue.Value = taggedValue.Value targetTaggedValue.Update end if next end function
'copies the tagged values from the source to the target function copyTaggedValues(source, target) dim sourceTag as EA.TaggedValue dim targetTag as EA.TaggedValue for each sourceTag in source.TaggedValues set targetTag = nothing 'first try to find target tag dim tag as EA.TaggedValue for each tag in target.TaggedValues if tag.Name = sourceTag.Name then set targetTag = tag exit for end if next 'if not found then create new if targetTag is nothing then set targetTag = target.TaggedValues.AddNew(sourceTag.Name,"TaggedValue") end if 'set value if not targetTag is nothing then targetTag.Value = sourceTag.Value targetTag.Notes = sourceTag.Notes targetTag.Update target.Update end if next end function
'copies the tagged values from the source to the target function copyAllTaggedValues(source, target) dim sourceTag as EA.TaggedValue dim targetTag as EA.TaggedValue for each sourceTag in source.TaggedValues set targetTag = nothing 'first try to find target tag, only use if empty dim tag as EA.TaggedValue for each tag in target.TaggedValues if tag.Name = sourceTag.Name _ AND len(tag.Value) = 0 then set targetTag = tag exit for end if next 'if not found then create new if targetTag is nothing then set targetTag = target.TaggedValues.AddNew(sourceTag.Name,"TaggedValue") end if 'set value if not targetTag is nothing then targetTag.Value = sourceTag.Value targetTag.Notes = sourceTag.Notes targetTag.Update target.Update end if next end function
'****************************************** ' ConnectorTaggedValue '******************************************
function getConnectorTaggedValueValue( connector, taggedValueName)
dim taggedValue as EA.ConnectorTag set taggedValue = connector.TaggedValues.GetByName( taggedValueName) getConnectorTaggedValueValue = taggedValue.Value
end function
sub setConnectorTaggedValueValue( connector, taggedValueName, taggedValueValue)
dim taggedValue as EA.ConnectorTag set taggedValue = connector.TaggedValues.GetByName( taggedValueName) if taggedValue is nothing then set taggedValue = connector.TaggedValues.AddNew( taggedValueName, vbNullString) end if taggedValue.Value = taggedValueValue taggedValue.Update end sub
'****************************************** ' Ownership '****************************************** ' Ownedship by element and expected metatype' ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- ' Function: getOwnedElementNameList ' Purpose: This function returns a list of names of elements owned by the ' provided 'element' that match any type within the 'ownedMetatypeList'. ' The function also includes the 'objectState' property value of the owned elements, if it exists. ' ' Inputs: ' - element: The EA.Element for which the owned elements' names are retrieved. ' - ownedMetatypeList: A string containing a comma-separated list of metatypes to filter owned elements. ' ' Outputs: ' - A string list of names of the owned elements matching the types in 'ownedMetatypeList', ' each name is followed by the element's 'objectState' if it exists. ' Names are separated by a newline character (vbCRLF). ' ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- function getOwnedElementNameList( element, ownedMetatypeList)
dim ownedElement as EA.Element dim nameList 'as String dim typeID 'as Integer dim typeElement as EA.Element dim elementName 'as String dim objectState 'as String
nameList = vbNullString if ownedMetatypeList <> vbNullString then ownedMetatypeList = ownedMetatypeList & "," end if
for each ownedElement in element.EmbeddedElements if InStr( ownedMetatypeList, ownedElement.MetaType & ",") then typeID = ownedElement.PropertyType if typeID = 0 then typeID = ownedElement.ClassfierID end if
if typeID = 0 then elementName = ownedElement.Name else set typeElement = Repository.GetElementByID( typeID) elementName = typeElement.Name end if
if nameList <> vbNullString then nameList = nameList & vbCRLF end if
nameList = nameList & elementName objectState = getCustomPropertyValue( ownedElement, "objectState") if objectState <> vbNullString then nameList = nameList & " [" & objectState & "]" end if end if next getOwnedElementNameList = nameList end function
' ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- ' Function: getChildElementList ' Purpose: ' returns a list of children of a certain stereotype.This function retrieves a list of child elements of a specified parent ' element that have a specific stereotype. ' ' Inputs: ' - parentElement: The parent EA.Element object for which the child elements ' are to be retrieved. ' - childStereotype: The stereotype of the child elements to retrieve. ' ' Outputs: ' - A Scripting.Dictionary object where the keys are the GUIDs of the child elements and ' the values are the EA.Element objects corresponding to the child elements with ' the provided stereotype. ' -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
function getChildElementList( parentElement, childStereotype)
dim childElement as EA.Element dim childElementList 'as Scripting.Dictionary set childElementList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary") for each childElement in parentElement.Elements if childElement.Stereotype = childStereotype then childElementList.Add childElement.ElementGUID, childElement end if next set getChildElementList = childElementList end function
function getCustomPropertyValue( ownedElement, propertyName)
dim customProperty as EA._CustomProperty dim propertyValue 'as String propertyValue = vbNullString
for each customProperty in ownedElement.CustomProperties if customProperty.Name = propertyName then propertyValue = customProperty.Value exit for end if next getCustomPropertyValue = propertyValue
end function
'****************************************** ' Package '****************************************** function getAncestorPackage( element, ancestorPackageLevel)
dim packageLevel 'as Integer dim packageID 'as Integer dim package as EA.Package
packageID = element.PackageID set package = Repository.GetPackageByID( packageID) for packageLevel = 2 to ancestorPackageLevel packageID = package.ParentID if packageID = 0 then exit for end if set package = Repository.GetPackageByID( packageID) next set getAncestorPackage = package
end function '****************************************** ' Diagram '****************************************** ' found a diagram inside an element by name function getChildDiagram( parentElement, childDiagramName)
dim childDiagram as EA.Diagram dim foundDiagram as EA.Diagram
set foundDiagram = nothing
for each childDiagram in parentElement.Diagrams if childDiagram.Name = childDiagramName then set foundDiagram = childDiagram exit for end if next set getChildDiagram = foundDiagram
end function

Column.name: Notes

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
!INC Wrappers.Include !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript
' Script Name: Elements -> create API Operations ' Author: Natha Paquette ' Purpose: create appropriate Operations for API elements based on connection to JSON Schema ' Date: 26/03/2024 '
' ' Diagram Script main function ' sub OnDiagramScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim currentDiagram as EA.Diagram dim diagramObject as EA.DiagramObject dim element as EA.Element dim jsonList 'as List dim listElement as EA.Element dim jsonElement as EA.Element
' fresh console Repository.ClearOutput "Script"
set currentDiagram = Repository.GetCurrentDiagram() if currentDiagram.SelectedObjects.Count = 1 then for each diagramObject in currentDiagram.SelectedObjects set element = Repository.GetElementByID (diagramObject.ElementID) if element.Metatype = "Open API" then session.output "API "& element.Name & " selected" set jsonList = getRelatedElementList (element, "Aggregation", "TMF_APIAggregatesSchema", "Class", "TMF_JSON_Schema") for each listElement in jsonList set jsonElement = Repository.GetElementByGuid (listElement) CreateOperation element, jsonElement, "TMF_APIOperation" Session.Output "Operations created for " & jsonElement.Name & ", API " & element.name next end if next Session.Output "done: all Operations created" else Session.Prompt "This script requires an element to be selected in a diagram to function", promptOK End if
end sub
OnDiagramScript

Column.value:
Sub PrintArray(vec,lo,hi) '==-----------------------------------------== '== Print out an array from the lo bound == '== to the hi bound. Highlight the column == '== whose number matches parm mark == '==-----------------------------------------==
Dim i,j,row call LOGTrace( "PrintArray: lo(" & lo & "),hi(" & hi & ")")
For i = lo to hi row="" For j = 0 to Ubound(vec,2) if j=0 then row = vec(i,j) else row = row & ":" & vec(i,j) end if Next 'call Session.Output(row) call LOGDebug (row)
Next call LOGDebug( "end of array")
End Sub 'PrintArray

' ' Script Name: Create Class Diagram ' Author: David Anderson ' Purpose: Sub routine called by the Run PlantUML Script to build a Class Diagram ' Date: 29-Mar-2019 ' ' 25-Sept-2022: Support C4 Diagrams '

sub CreateClassDiagram () call LOGInfo("Create Class Diagram script activated")
if instr(Ucase(theSelectedElement.Notes),"C4-PLANTUML") > 0 then CreateC4Diagram () else LOGWarning("This script does not yet support " & currentDiagram.Type & " diagrams") end if
call LOGInfo ( "Create Class Diagram Script Complete" ) call LOGInfo ( "=========================================" )
