Column.value: <Script Name="Util - move element to correct package" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC Utils.Model Management Utilities !INC Utils.Util ' ' Script Name: Util - move element to correct package ' Author: Giu ' Purpose: this script supports models that are aggregated by groups elements and on the same time , listed in packages with the same name of the grouping element. ' The script will move the element under a package with the same name of the grouping element. ' Date: 2023 12 06 '
sub OnProjectBrowserScript() ' configure this GroupingStereotypeName = "TMF_MetricGroup" GroupingMetaTypeName = "Metric Group" StereotypeName = "TMF_Metric" MetaTypeName = "Metric" ' end of config
Dim metricElement As EA.Element Dim metricGroupElement As EA.Element dim treeSelectedType dim Masterpackage as EA.Package dim pkg as EA.Package dim targetPackage as EA.Package dim GroupingStereotypeName, StereotypeName dim GroupingMetaTypeName, MetaTypeName dim connector as EA.Connector dim Query 'as string Dim result Dim resultArray Dim sqlGetPackage
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() select case treeSelectedType case otPackage set Masterpackage = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() ' Iterate through all elements with the "TMF_metric" stereotype 'For Each metricElement In Repository.Models.GetElementsByQuery("SELECT * FROM t_object WHERE Stereotype='TMF_metric'") for each metricElement in Masterpackage.Elements ' find those of a specific metatype and set the RefGUID of their associated package if metricElement.MetaType = MetaTypeName then session.output("processing: " & metricElement.name) ' Find the connected "TMF_MetricGroup" element via a "TMF_MetricGroupMetric" relationship
Set metricGroupElement = Nothing For Each connector In metricElement.Connectors If connector.Stereotype = "TMF_MetricGroupMetric" Then Set metricGroupElement = Repository.GetElementByID(connector.SupplierID) Exit For End If Next
' Check if a valid "TMF_MetricGroup" element was found If Not metricGroupElement Is Nothing Then ' Use a SQL query to find the target package with the same name
sqlGetPackage = "SELECT o.Package_ID FROM t_package as o WHERE o.Name = '" & metricGroupElement.Name & "'" session.output("executing query: " & sqlGetPackage) Query = Repository.SQLQuery(sqlGetPackage) session.output("result of query: " & Query) resultArray = convertQueryResultToArray(Query) If Not IsEmpty(resultArray) Then ' Get the first package ID from the result for each result in resultArray on error resume next session.output("Get the corresponding package based on package ID: " & result) set targetPackage = Repository.GetPackageByID(result) ' Move the "TMF_metric" element to the found package If Not targetPackage Is Nothing Then session.output("found package: " & targetPackage.name) metricElement.PackageID = targetPackage.PackageID metricElement.Update End If next ' for each result in resultArray End If ' is not empty End If 'Not metricGroupElement Is Nothing Then end if ' metricElement.MetaType = MetaTypeName Next ' for each metricElement session.output("done processing " & MetaTypeName ) case else Session.Prompt "This script is looking for elements " = MetaTypeName + "in a package.", promptOK end select end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="FF - Create Composition extended" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC Utils.Include !INC Utils.Model Management Utilities
' Script Name: Create FF Compositions extended WIP ' Author: Giu Platania ' Purpose: THis script will traverse a project tree and extract all the element with a certain stereotype ' It will then get the children of the current element and create a relationship between the owner and the child ' Date: 2023.12 ' TODO: add check to avoid duplicate relationship ' TODO: ' retrieve element ' retrieve Tagged Value called RefGUID ' get corresponding package ' get all element in that package
Dim componentElementCount, componentControllerClassCreated 'Used to check if there are any use case element are available and throw an error when no use case element is present. componentElementCount = 0 componentControllerClassCreated = 0 dim Stereo, connType, connStereotype Stereo = "TMF_Function" connType = "Aggregation" connStereotype = "TMF_AFGreggatesFunction"
'
Function createRelationship(fromElement) dim childElement as EA.Element dim childElementList 'as Scripting.Dictionary set childElementList = getChildElementList(fromElement,Stereo)
for each childElement in fromElement.Elements if childElement.Stereotype = stereo then addConnector childElement, connType, connStereotype, fromElement Session.Output( "created relationship from " + childElement.Name + " to " + fromElement.name ) fromElement.Update childElement.Update end if next end function
function retrieveCorrespondingPackage(packagesubElement) dim refguid ' as string 'dim retrieveCorrespondingPackage as EA.Package ' retrieve Tagged Value called RefGUID refguid = packagesubElement.ElementGUID ' get Package with a tagged value set retrieveCorrespondingPackage = lookupElementTaggedValue("RefGUID", refguid,"", "package") ' get corresponding package 'set retrieveCorrespondingPackag Repository.GetPackageByGuid(refguid) 'Session.Output( "found package " + retrieveCorrespondingPackag.Name) ' get all element in that package end function
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
' Get the type of element selected in the Project Browser dim treeSelectedType treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() select case treeSelectedType case otPackage ' this is a package containing elelemets 1-6 dim basePackageElement as EA.Element dim packagesubElement as EA.Element 'level 1 dim subElement as EA.Element ''level 2 dim subsubElement as EA.Element '' level 3 dim subsubsubElement as EA.Element '' level 4 dim subsubsubsubElement as EA.Element '' level 5 dim subsubsubsubsubElement as EA.Element '' level 6 dim CorrespondingPackage as EA.Package' the package with the GUID of the element
dim packageElementIndex, packageElementCount set basePackageElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() Session.Output( "package " + basePackageElement.Name) packageElementCount = basePackageElement.Elements.Count - 1 set basePackageElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject()
for packageElementIndex = 0 to packageElementCount '''level 1 set packagesubElement = basePackageElement.Elements.GetAt(packageElementIndex) set CorrespondingPackage = retrieveCorrespondingPackage(packagesubElement) createRelationship(CorrespondingPackage) ''level 2 for each subElement in packagesubElement.Elements createRelationship(subElement) '' level 3 if subElement.Elements.Count > 0 then for each subsubElement in subElement.Elements createRelationship(subsubElement) '' lev 4 if subsubElement.Elements.Count > 0 then for each subsubsubElement in subsubElement.Elements createRelationship(subsubsubElement) ''lev 5 if subsubsubElement.Elements.Count > 0 then for each subsubsubsubElement in subsubsubElement.Elements createRelationship(subsubsubsubElement) next componentElementCount = componentElementCount + 1 end if '' lev 5 next componentElementCount = componentElementCount + 1 end if '' lev 4 next end If '' level 3 componentElementCount = componentElementCount + 1 next componentElementCount = componentElementCount + 1 next 'packageElementIndex case otElement 'element selected dim Element as EA.Element set packagesubElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() createRelationship(packagesubElement) componentElementCount =componentElementCount + 1 ''level 2 for each subElement in packagesubElement.Elements createRelationship(subElement) '' level 3 if subElement.Elements.Count > 0 then for each subsubElement in subElement.Elements createRelationship(subsubElement) '' lev 4 if subsubElement.Elements.Count > 0 then for each subsubsubElement in subsubElement.Elements createRelationship(subsubsubElement) ''lev 5 if subsubsubElement.Elements.Count > 0 then for each subsubsubsubElement in subsubsubElement.Elements createRelationship(subsubsubsubElement) next componentElementCount = componentElementCount + 1 end if '' lev 5 next componentElementCount = componentElementCount + 1 end if '' lev 4 next end If '' level 3 componentElementCount = componentElementCount + 1 next end select
if componentElementCount > 0 then Session.Prompt "relationship created for for" & componentElementCount & " " & Stereo, promptOK else Session.Prompt "relationship can ONLY be created for elements of type" & Stereo, promptOK end if end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript()

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="gen Excel - API operations" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
Option Explicit
' Create an Excel file that lists all TMF API and their operations in a package
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC Wrappers.Include
Sub OnProjectBrowserScript() Dim treeSelectedType Dim package As EA.Package
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType()
Select Case treeSelectedType Case otPackage Set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedPackage() If Not package Is Nothing Then ' Create Excel file and write header Dim excelOutput Set excelOutput = CreateObject("Excel.Application")
' Create a new workbook Dim workbook Set workbook = excelOutput.Workbooks.Add
' Create a new worksheet Dim worksheet Set worksheet = workbook.Worksheets(1) worksheet.Name = package.Name
' Write header worksheet.Cells(1, 1).Value = "Element Name" worksheet.Cells(1, 2).Value = "Element Type" worksheet.Cells(1, 3).Value = "Operation" worksheet.Cells(1, 4).Value = "Parameters" worksheet.Cells(1, 5).Value = "ReturnType"
' Start writing elements from the second row Dim currentRow currentRow = 2
' Collect elements and their operations in the package CollectElementsInPackage package, worksheet, currentRow
workbook.Saveas getUserSelectedFileName ' WTF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!?????????????????? excelOutput.Visible = True excelOutput.Quit Session.Output " Finished Export API Tree '"
End If
Case Else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK End Select End Sub
Sub CollectElementsInPackage(package, worksheet, currentRow) Dim element As EA.Element Dim operation as EA.Method
' Loop through each element in the package For Each element In package.Elements If element.Stereotype = "TMF_API" then ' Write the current element's information to the worksheet WriteElementToWorksheet element, worksheet, currentRow
' Increment the current row for the next element currentRow = currentRow + 1
' Collect operations of the current element For Each operation In element.Methods WriteOperationToWorksheet operation, worksheet, currentRow if operation.Parameters.Count > 0 then 'WriteParameterToWorksheet operation, worksheet, currentRow worksheet.Cells(currentRow, 4).Value = GetParameterNames(operation) end if currentRow = currentRow + 1 Next End If Next End Sub
Sub WriteElementToWorksheet(element, worksheet, currentRow) ' Write element information to the worksheet worksheet.Cells(currentRow, 1).Value = element.Name worksheet.Cells(currentRow, 2).Value = element.Stereotype End Sub
Sub WriteOperationToWorksheet(operation, worksheet, currentRow) ' Write operation information to the worksheet worksheet.Cells(currentRow, 3).Value = operation.Name worksheet.Cells(currentRow, 5).Value = operation.ReturnType
End Sub
sub WriteParameterToWorksheet (operation, worksheet, currentRow) Dim i dim j i = operation.Parameters.Count - 1 dim Parameter as EA.Parameter For j = 0 to i Set Parameter = operation.Parameters.GetAt(j) worksheet.Cells(currentRow, 4).Value = Parameter.Type currentRow = currentRow + 1 next End Sub
Function getUserSelectedFileName() Dim selectedFileName Dim project Set project = Repository.GetProjectInterface() selectedFileName = project.GetFileNameDialog("", "Excel Files|*.xls;*.xlsx;*.xlsm", 1, 2, "", 1) ' Save as with overwrite prompt: OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT getUserSelectedFileName = selectedFileName End Function
OnProjectBrowserScript()

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="eTOM - Create Process Diagram Lev 5-7" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit ' applied to a package, will create diagram containing elements of level 5,6 and 7 for each element of the package !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element ' lev 1 dim subElement as EA.Element ' lev 2 dim subsubElement as EA.Element ' lev 3 dim subsubsubElement as EA.Element ' lev 4 dim startElement as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "starting" select case treeSelectedType case otPackage
set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() Session.Output "package "+ package.Name + " selected" set levelList = getDiagramLevelList for each element in package.Elements for each subElement in element.Elements for each subsubElement in subElement.Elements 'for each subsubsubElement in subsubElement.Elements Session.Output "element " + subsubElement.Name + " found!" if subsubElement.MetaType = "eTOM Process" AND subsubElement.Elements.Count > 0 then createNestedHierarchyDiagram subsubElement, levelList, "custom", false 'createNestedHierarchyDiagram subsubsubElement, levelList, "custom", false end if 'next next next next case else Session.Prompt "This script support items of type package.", promptOK end select Session.Output "done" end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test("{B8FDEF86-54B6-4964-B33D-2A7783432493}")
sub Test(packageGUID) dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element Session.Output "starting" set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "Process" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if next end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 2 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level1.objectHeight = 100 level1.objectWidth = 200 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20
level1.objectstyle.fillcolor = cololorKhakh1 level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 12 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
levelList.Add 1, level1
' *** 2nd LEVEL ***
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 3 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level2.objectHeight = 60 level2.objectWidth = 180 level2.horizOffset = 20 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 50 level2.vertSpace = 10
' level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = cololorKhakh1 level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Arial" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 10 levellist.add 2, level2
' *** 3rd LEVEL *** set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 3 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION
level3.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level3.objectHeight = 50 level3.objectWidth = 160 level3.horizOffset = 20 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 3
level3.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level3.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level3.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level3.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL ***
set level4 = New HierarchyLevel
level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level4.objectHeight = 40 level4.objectWidth = 140 level4.horizOffset = 20 level4.horizSpace = 3 level4.vertOffset = 50 level4.vertSpace = 3 level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 4, level4 set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

Column.name: Notes
Column.value: <Script Name="eTOM -Create Process Dia From Element" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
' create a diagram with up - to 4 levels of eTOM elements inside any selected process
option explicit
!INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element ' lev 1 dim subElement as EA.Element ' lev 2 dim subsubElement as EA.Element ' lev 3 dim subsubsubElement as EA.Element ' lev 4 dim startElement as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "starting" select case treeSelectedType case otElement ' Code for when an element is selected dim theElement as EA.Element set theElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() Session.Output "Element "+ theElement.Name + " selected" set levelList = getDiagramLevelList for each element in theElement.Elements ' for each subElement in element.Elements ' for each subsubElement in subElement.Elements 'for each subsubsubElement in subsubElement.Elements Session.Output "element " + element.Name + " found!" if element.MetaType = "eTOM Process" AND element.Elements.Count > 0 then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "custom", false 'createNestedHierarchyDiagram subsubsubElement, levelList, "custom", false end if ' 'next ' next ' next next case else Session.Prompt "This script support items of type Etom process.", promptOK end select Session.Output "done" end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test("{B8FDEF86-54B6-4964-B33D-2A7783432493}")
sub Test(packageGUID) dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element Session.Output "starting" set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "Process" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if next end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 2 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level1.objectHeight = 100 level1.objectWidth = 200 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20
level1.objectstyle.fillcolor = cololorKhakh1 level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 12 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
levelList.Add 1, level1
' *** 2nd LEVEL ***
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 3 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level2.objectHeight = 60 level2.objectWidth = 180 level2.horizOffset = 20 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 50 level2.vertSpace = 10
' level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = cololorKhakh1 level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Arial" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 10 levellist.add 2, level2
' *** 3rd LEVEL *** set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 3 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION
level3.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level3.objectHeight = 50 level3.objectWidth = 160 level3.horizOffset = 20 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 3
level3.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level3.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level3.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level3.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL ***
set level4 = New HierarchyLevel
level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "eTOM Process" level4.objectHeight = 40 level4.objectWidth = 140 level4.horizOffset = 20 level4.horizSpace = 3 level4.vertOffset = 50 level4.vertSpace = 3 level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 4, level4 set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

option explicit ' Script Name: Create Metric Diagram ' Author: gplatania@tmforum.org ' Purpose: create a diagram with all the AF and the related functions ' Date: 2022-06025 !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "Create Function diagram....starting..." select case treeSelectedType case otPackage set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() set levelList = getDiagramLevelList ' for each element in package.Elements ' Session.Output "element type " + element.MetaType + " found!" ' for each subElement in element.Elements ' if subElement.MetaType = "TMF DMM Dimension" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram package, levelList, "Aggregated Function;Function", false ''params: parentItem, levelList, diagramType, openDiagram ' end if ' next ' next case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK end select Session.Output "Done!" end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test "{66A70E55-2B99-4e54-8893-B0D7224818DD}"
sub Test(packageGUID)
dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element dim subElement as EA.Element set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList for each element in package.Elements
createNestedHierarchyDiagram subElement, levelList, "Aggregated Function", false next end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL ***
set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 1 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function;Function" level1.objectHeight = 120 level1.objectWidth = 400 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 10 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 10
level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 12 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "0" ' true level1.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
level1.elementProfiles.Add "Function", elementProfileFunc
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 3 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function;Function" level2.objectHeight = 70 level2.objectWidth = 300 level2.horizOffset = 25 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 50 level2.vertSpace = 20
level2.objectstyle.fillColor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontName = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontSize = 9
dim elementProfileFunc set elementProfileFunc = new ElementProfile
dim relationProfileFunc set relationProfileFunc = new RelationProfile relationProfileFunc.nestingType = "Nested"
elementProfileFunc.relationProfiles.Add "NestedFunc", relationProfileFunc elementProfileFunc.elementMetatype = "Function"
dim relationProfileAggFunc set relationProfileAggFunc = new RelationProfile relationProfileAggFunc.nestingType = "Nested"
dim elementProfileAggFunc set elementProfileAggFunc = new ElementProfile elementProfileAggFunc.relationProfiles.Add "NestedAggFunc", relationProfileAggFunc elementProfileAggFunc.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function"
level2.elementProfiles.Add "Function", elementProfileFunc level2.elementProfiles.Add "AggFunction", elementProfileAggFunc
levellist.add 2, level2
' begin level 3 definition set level3 = new hierarchylevel
level3.numobjects = 3 level3.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level3.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function;Function" level3.objectHeight = 70 level3.objectWidth = 300 level3.horizOffset = 25 level3.horizSpace = 10 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 20
level3.objectstyle.fillColor = colorWhite level3.objectstyle.fontName = "Calibri" level3.objectstyle.fontSize = 9
' begin level 3 function element profile dim Level3FuncElementProfile set Level3FuncElementProfile = new ElementProfile Level3FuncElementProfile.elementMetatype = "Function"
' begin level 3 function element profile, aggregation relation profile dim Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr set Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr = new RelationProfile Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr.nestingType = "Related" Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr.relationType = "Aggregation" Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr.relatedStereotype = "TMF_AF" Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr.relatedType = "Class" Level3FuncElementProfile.relationProfiles.Add "AggregatedRel", Level3FuncRelationProfileAggr ' end level 3 function element profile, aggregation relation profile
' end level 3 function element profile
' begin level 3 Aggregated Function element profile dim Level3AggFuncElementProfile set Level3AggFuncElementProfile = new ElementProfile Level3AggFuncElementProfile.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function"
' begin level 3 aggregated function element profile, nested profile dim Level3NestRelationProfile set Level3NestRelationProfile = new RelationProfile Level3NestRelationProfile.nestingType = "Nested" Level3AggFuncElementProfile.relationProfiles.Add "Nested", Level3NestRelationProfile ' end level 3 aggregated function element profile, nested profile
' end level 3 Aggregated Function element profile
level3.elementProfiles.Add "Function", Level3FuncElementProfile level3.elementProfiles.Add "AggFunction", Level3AggFuncElementProfile
levellist.add 3, level3 ' end level 3 set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

sub Test(packageGUID) dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element Session.Output "starting Domain AF Function diagram" set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "Aggregated Function;Function" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if next end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL *** set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 2 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function;Function" level1.objectHeight = 100 level1.objectWidth = 200 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20 level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 14 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
' begin level 1 aggregated function element profile dim AggFuncProfile set AggFuncProfile = new ElementProfile AggFuncProfile.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level1.elementProfiles.Add 1, AggFuncProfile
' begin level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested relation profile dim AggFuncNested set AggFuncNested = new RelationProfile AggFuncNested.nestingType = "Nested"
AggFuncProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, AggFuncNested ' end level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested relation profile ' end level 1 aggregated function element profile
' begin level 1 function element profile dim L1FuncProfile set L1FuncProfile = new ElementProfile L1FuncProfile.elementMetatype = "Function"
' begin level 1 function element profile, nested relation profile dim L1FuncNested set L1FuncNested = new RelationProfile L1FuncNested.nestingType = "Nested"
L1FuncProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, L1FuncNested ' end level 1 function element profile, nested relation profile level1.elementProfiles.Add 2, L1FuncProfile ' end level 1 function element profile
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 3 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "Function" level2.objectHeight = 45 level2.objectWidth = 100 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 80 level2.vertSpace = 10 'level2.nestingType = "Related" 'level2.relationType = "Aggregation" 'level2.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction;TMF_DomainAggregatesDomain" 'level2.relatedType = "Class" 'level2.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function" 'level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 10
' begin level 2 function element profile dim L2FuncProfile set L2FuncProfile = new ElementProfile L2FuncProfile.elementMetatype = "Function"
' begin level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile dim L2FuncRelatedAF set L2FuncRelatedAF = new RelationProfile L2FuncRelatedAF.nestingType = "Related" L2FuncRelatedAF.relationType = "Aggregation" L2FuncRelatedAF.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" L2FuncRelatedAF.relatedType = "Class" L2FuncRelatedAF.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
L2FuncProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, L2FuncRelatedAF ' end level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile
' begin level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile dim L2FuncRelatedAD set L2FuncRelatedAD = new RelationProfile L2FuncRelatedAD.nestingType = "Related" L2FuncRelatedAD.relationType = "Aggregation" L2FuncRelatedAD.relationStereotype = "TMF_DomainAggregatesDomain" L2FuncRelatedAD.relatedType = "Class" L2FuncRelatedAD.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
L2FuncProfile.relationProfiles.Add 2, L2FuncRelatedAD ' end level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile
level2.elementProfiles.Add 1, L2FuncProfile ' end level 2 function element profile
levellist.add 2, level2
' *** 3rd LEVEL *** NOT ACITVE set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 3 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION
level3.elementMetatype = "Function" level3.objectHeight = 38 level3.objectWidth = 105 level3.horizOffset = 30 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 3 'level3.nestingType = "Related" 'level3.relationType = "Aggregation" 'level3.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" 'level3.relatedType = "Class" 'level3.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
level3.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level3.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level3.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 9 'level3.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
'levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL *** NOT ACITVE set level4 = New HierarchyLevel
level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level4.objectHeight = 30 level4.objectWidth = 85 level4.horizOffset = 20 level4.horizSpace = 3 level4.vertOffset = 50 level4.vertSpace = 3 'level4.nestingType = "Related" 'level4.relationType = "Aggregation" 'level4.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" 'level4.relatedType = "Class" 'level4.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
'levelList.Add 4, level4
set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

Column.value: <Script Name="ALL - Create Diagram Selected Element and Children" Type="Internal" Language="VBScript"/>

Column.name: Script
Column.value:
option explicit !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript '
' ' Script Name: ' Author: ' Purpose: Create a diagram with all the children (owned) elements and the parent (if Any). Diagram layout is WIP. ' Date:
' Project Browser Script main function
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
' Get the type of element selected in the Project Browser dim theElement as EA.Element dim treeSelectedType treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "Starting Diagram" ' Handling Code: Uncomment any types you wish this script to support ' NOTE: You can toggle comments on multiple lines that are currently ' selected with [CTRL]+[SHIFT]+[C]. select case treeSelectedType
case otElement ' Code for when an element is selected set theElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() Session.Output "OK, Its an element of stereotype " + theElement.Stereotype createDiagram (theElement)
' case otPackage ' ' Code for when a package is selected ' dim thePackage as EA.Package ' set thePackage = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() ' createDiagram theElement ' ' case otDiagram ' ' Code for when a diagram is selected ' dim theDiagram as EA.Diagram ' set theDiagram = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() ' ' case otAttribute ' ' Code for when an attribute is selected ' dim theAttribute as EA.Attribute ' set theAttribute = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() ' ' case otMethod ' ' Code for when a method is selected ' dim theMethod as EA.Method ' set theMethod = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject()
case else ' Error message Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK
end select end sub
sub createDiagram(theElement) ' Create a new diagram and set its properties Dim newDiagram as EA.Diagram Dim selectedElement as EA.Element Set selectedElement = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject()
Set newDiagram = selectedElement.Diagrams.AddNew( selectedElement.Name & "_Diagram", "Logical") newDiagram.Author = "Your Name" newDiagram.Notes = "This diagram shows the element" + selectedElement.Name + " and its children" newDiagram.Version = "1.0" newDiagram.PackageID = selectedElement.PackageID newDiagram.Update() Session.Output "New Diagram created" ' Add the selected element and its parent to the diagram
Dim selectedObject as EA.DiagramObject set selectedObject = newDiagram.DiagramObjects.AddNew ("", "")
selectedObject.ElementID = selectedElement.ElementID selectedObject.Update() newDiagram.Update()
Dim parent as EA.Element
If Not selectedElement.ParentID = 0 Then Set parent = Repository.GetElementByID(selectedElement.ParentID) If Not parent is Nothing Then Set selectedObject = newDiagram.DiagramObjects.AddNew ("", "") selectedObject.ElementID = parent.ElementID selectedObject.Update() Session.Output "Parent Objects"+ selectedObject.name + " added" End If Else Session.Output "No Parent objects found" End If
' Add all child elements to the diagram
Dim child as EA.Element If selectedElement.Elements.Count = 0 Then Session.Output "No Child Objects found" Else For Each child In selectedElement.Elements Set selectedObject = newDiagram.DiagramObjects.AddNew("", "") selectedObject.ElementID = child.ElementID selectedObject.Update() Session.Output "a Child Object was added" next End If ' Refresh the diagram view in the EA interface Repository.ReloadDiagram(newDiagram.DiagramID)
'' layout the diagram layoutDiagram newDiagram.DiagramID ' Save the changes to the project newDiagram.Update()
Session.Prompt "Finished!", promptOK ' End of script end sub
sub layoutDiagram(DiagramGUID) Dim LayoutStyle, Iterations, LayerSpacing, ColumnSpacing, SaveToDiagram Dim Project As EA.Project Dim Repository As EA.Repository
Set Repository = CreateObject("EA.Repository") Set Project = Repository.GetProjectInterface() Session.Output "layout Diagram"
'DiagramGUID = Project.GUIDtoXML(Repository.GetCurrentDiagram().DiagramGUID)
'See ConstLayoutStyles in EAConstants-VBcript 'LayoutStyle = lsDiagramDefault 'LayoutStyle = lsCycleRemoveDFS 'Or lsLayeringOptimalLinkLength Or lsInitializeDFSOut Or lsLayoutDirectionDown LayoutStyle = lsLayoutDirectionDown
Iterations = 4 LayerSpacing = 20 ColumnSpacing = 20 SaveToDiagram = true
dim diagramGUIDXml 'The project interface needs GUID's in XML format, so we need to convert first. diagramGUIDXml = Repository.GetProjectInterface().GUIDtoXML(DiagramGUID) 'Then call the layout operation Session.Output "diagram UID in Xml " + diagramGUIDXml Repository.GetProjectInterface().LayoutDiagramEx diagramGUIDXml, lsDiagramDefault, 4, 20 , 20, false
'Project.LayoutDiagramEx DiagramGUID, LayoutStyle, Iterations, LayerSpacing, ColumnSpacing, SaveToDiagram end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript

option explicit ' create a huge diagram with all the Domains AF and function. the resulting diagram is overwhelming. !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants

treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "starting AF" select case treeSelectedType case otPackage Session.Output "package selected" set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" set levelList = getDiagramLevelList 'for each element in package.Elements 'Session.Output "element type " + element.MetaType + " found!" 'if element.MetaType = "Aggregated Function" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram package, levelList, "custom", false 'end if 'next case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK end select Session.Output "done" end sub

sub Test(packageGUID) dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element Session.Output "starting Domain AF Function diagram" set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "Domain" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if next end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL *** ' *** FIRST LEVEL *** set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 2 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "Domain" level1.objectHeight = 100 level1.objectWidth = 200 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20 level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 14 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
' begin level 1 aggregated function element profile dim DomainProfile set DomainProfile = new ElementProfile DomainProfile.elementMetatype = "Domain" level1.elementProfiles.Add 1, DomainProfile
' begin level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested relation profile dim DomainNested set DomainNested = new RelationProfile DomainNested.nestingType = "Nested"
DomainProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, DomainNested ' end level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested relation profile ' end level 1 aggregated function element profile
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 3 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level2.objectHeight = 110 level2.objectWidth = 230 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 80 level2.vertSpace = 10 level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 10
' begin level 2 function element profile dim L2AFProfile set L2AFProfile = new ElementProfile L2AFProfile.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function"
' begin level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile dim L2AFRelatedFunction set L2AFRelatedFunction = new RelationProfile L2AFRelatedFunction.nestingType = "Related" L2AFRelatedFunction.relationType = "Aggregation" L2AFRelatedFunction.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" L2AFRelatedFunction.relatedType = "Class" L2AFRelatedFunction.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
L2AFProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, L2AFRelatedFunction ' end level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile
' begin level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile dim L2AFRelatedAD set L2AFRelatedAD = new RelationProfile L2AFRelatedAD.nestingType = "Related" L2AFRelatedAD.relationType = "Aggregation" L2AFRelatedAD.relationStereotype = "TMF_DomainAggregatesFunction" L2AFRelatedAD.relatedType = "Class" L2AFRelatedAD.relatedStereotype = "TMF_AF"
L2AFProfile.relationProfiles.Add 2, L2AFRelatedAD ' end level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile
level2.elementProfiles.Add 1, L2AFProfile ' end level 2 function element profile
levellist.add 2, level2
' *** 3rd LEVEL *** set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 4 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION level3.elementMetatype = "Function" level3.objectHeight = 60 level3.objectWidth = 180 level3.horizOffset = 30 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 3 level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 9
' begin level 3 function element profile dim L3FunctionProfile set L3FunctionProfile = new ElementProfile L3FunctionProfile.elementMetatype = "Function"
' begin level 3 function element profile, AF relation profile dim L3FunctionRelatedAF set L3FunctionRelatedAF = new RelationProfile L3FunctionRelatedAF.nestingType = "Related" L3FunctionRelatedAF.relationType = "Aggregation" L3FunctionRelatedAF.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" L3FunctionRelatedAF.relatedType = "Class" L3FunctionRelatedAF.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
L3FunctionProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, L3FunctionRelatedAF ' end level 3 function element profile, function relation profile
level3.elementProfiles.Add 1, L3FunctionProfile
levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL *** set level4 = New HierarchyLevel ' level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level4.objectHeight = 30 level4.objectWidth = 85 level4.horizOffset = 20 level4.horizSpace = 3 level4.vertOffset = 50 level4.vertSpace = 3 level4.nestingType = "Related" level4.relationType = "Aggregation" level4.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" level4.relatedType = "Class" level4.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function" ' level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
levelList.Add 4, level4
set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

option explicit ' create a diagram with all the AF and the functions !INC Local Scripts.EAConstants-VBScript !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Create Nested Hierarchy Diagram !INC BIZBOK Diagram Utility Scripts.Color Constants
sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "starting AF" select case treeSelectedType case otPackage Session.Output "package selected" set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" set levelList = getDiagramLevelList for each element in package.Elements Session.Output "element type " + element.MetaType + " found!" if element.MetaType = "Aggregated Function" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "custom", false end if next
case otElement set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Set element = Repository.GetContextObject() Session.Output "element type " + element.MetaType + " found!" if element.MetaType = "Aggregated Function" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "custom", false end if case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK end select Session.Output "done" end sub
OnProjectBrowserScript 'test("{B8FDEF86-54B6-4964-B33D-2A7783432493}")
sub Test(packageGUID) dim package As EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element Session.Output "starting AF diagram" set package = Repository.GetPackageByGuid(packageGUID) set levelList = getDiagramLevelList Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" for each element in package.Elements if element.MetaType = "Aggregated Function" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "Custom", false end if next end sub
function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL *** set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 2 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level1.objectHeight = 100 level1.objectWidth = 300 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20 level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 14 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
' begin level 1 aggregated function element profile dim AggFuncProfile set AggFuncProfile = new ElementProfile AggFuncProfile.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level1.elementProfiles.Add 1, AggFuncProfile
' begin level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested relation profile dim AggFuncNested set AggFuncNested = new RelationProfile AggFuncNested.nestingType = "Nested"
AggFuncProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, AggFuncNested ' end level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested relation profile ' end level 1 aggregated function element profile
levelList.Add 1, level1
set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 3 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "Function" level2.objectHeight = 60 level2.objectWidth = 150 level2.horizOffset = 10 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 80 level2.vertSpace = 10 'level2.nestingType = "Related" 'level2.relationType = "Aggregation" 'level2.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction;TMF_DomainAggregatesDomain" 'level2.relatedType = "Class" 'level2.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function" 'level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 10
' begin level 2 function element profile dim L2FuncProfile set L2FuncProfile = new ElementProfile L2FuncProfile.elementMetatype = "Function"
' begin level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile dim L2FuncRelatedAF set L2FuncRelatedAF = new RelationProfile L2FuncRelatedAF.nestingType = "Related" L2FuncRelatedAF.relationType = "Aggregation" L2FuncRelatedAF.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" L2FuncRelatedAF.relatedType = "Class" L2FuncRelatedAF.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
L2FuncProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, L2FuncRelatedAF ' end level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile
' begin level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile dim L2FuncRelatedAD set L2FuncRelatedAD = new RelationProfile L2FuncRelatedAD.nestingType = "Related" L2FuncRelatedAD.relationType = "Aggregation" L2FuncRelatedAD.relationStereotype = "TMF_DomainAggregatesDomain" L2FuncRelatedAD.relatedType = "Class" L2FuncRelatedAD.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
L2FuncProfile.relationProfiles.Add 2, L2FuncRelatedAD ' end level 2 function element profile, AF relation profile
level2.elementProfiles.Add 1, L2FuncProfile ' end level 2 function element profile
levellist.add 2, level2
' *** 3rd LEVEL *** NOT ACITVE set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 3 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION
level3.elementMetatype = "Function" level3.objectHeight = 50 level3.objectWidth = 160 level3.horizOffset = 30 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 50 level3.vertSpace = 3 'level3.nestingType = "Related" 'level3.relationType = "Aggregation" 'level3.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" 'level3.relatedType = "Class" 'level3.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
level3.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level3.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level3.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 9 'level3.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
'levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL *** NOT ACITVE set level4 = New HierarchyLevel
level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level4.objectHeight = 40 level4.objectWidth = 140 level4.horizOffset = 20 level4.horizSpace = 3 level4.vertOffset = 50 level4.vertSpace = 3 'level4.nestingType = "Related" 'level4.relationType = "Aggregation" 'level4.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" 'level4.relatedType = "Class" 'level4.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
'levelList.Add 4, level4

' for each subElement in element.Elements ' if subElement.MetaType = "TMF DMM Dimension" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram component, levelList, "Aggregated Function;Function", false ''params: parentItem, levelList, diagramType, openDiagram ' end if ' next ' next case else Session.Prompt "This script does not support items of this type.", promptOK end select Session.Output "Done!" end sub

function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL *** set level1 = new hierarchylevel level1.isParent = True level1.numObjects = 1 level1.objectHeight = 80 level1.objectWidth = 250 'level1.objectstyle.fillColor = colorWhite level1.objectstyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectstyle.fontSize = 16
' begin level 2 definition set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 3 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.elementMetatype = "TMF_ABE;TMF_Process" level2.objectHeight = 50 level2.objectWidth = 170 level2.horizOffset = 25 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 50 level2.vertSpace = 20
'level2.objectstyle.fillColor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontName = "Calibri" level2.objectstyle.fontSize = 9
' begin level 1 function element profile dim TMF_ABE set TMF_ABE = new ElementProfile TMF_ABE.elementMetatype = "TMF_ABE"
' begin level 1 function element profile, aggregation relation profile dim TMF_ComponentsDependsABE set TMF_ComponentsDependsABE = new RelationProfile TMF_ComponentsDependsABE.nestingType = "Related" TMF_ComponentsDependsABE.relationType = "Dependency" TMF_ComponentsDependsABE.relationStereotype = "TMF_ComponentDependsOnABE" TMF_ComponentsDependsABE.relatedStereotype = "TMF_ABE" TMF_ComponentsDependsABE.relatedType = "Class" ' end level 1 function element profile, aggregation relation profile
TMF_ABE.relationProfiles.Add 1, TMF_ComponentsDependsABE ' end level 1 function element profile
' begin level 1 Aggregated Function element profile dim TMF_Process set TMF_Process = new ElementProfile TMF_Process.elementMetatype = "TMF_Process"
' begin level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested profile dim TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess set TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess = new RelationProfile TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess.nestingType = "Related" TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess.relationType = "Dependency" TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess.relationStereotype = "TMF_ComponentDependsProcess" TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Process" TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess.relatedType = "Class" ' end level 1 aggregated function element profile, nested profile
TMF_Process.relationProfiles.Add 1, TMF_ComponentsDependsProcess ' end level 1 Aggregated Function element profile
level2.elementProfiles.Add 1, TMF_ABE level2.elementProfiles.Add 2, TMF_Process
' a null value at levellist 1 will include the parent object in the diagramw levellist.add 1, level1 levellist.add 2, level2 ' end level 1 set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

function getDiagramLevelList
dim levelList ' as Scripting.Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim level1 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level2 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level3 ' as HierarchyLevel dim level4 ' as HierarchyLevel
set levelList = CreateObject("Scripting.Dictionary")
' *** FIRST LEVEL *** set level1 = New HierarchyLevel
level1.numObjects = 1 level1.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level1.elementMetatype = "ODA Function Block" level1.objectHeight = 500 level1.objectWidth = 2000 level1.horizOffset = 10 level1.horizSpace = 20 level1.vertOffset = 10 level1.vertSpace = 20
level1.objectStyle.fontName = "Calibri" level1.objectStyle.fontSize = 20 level1.objectStyle.fontBold = "1" ' true
' begin level 1 oda function block element profile dim BlockElementProfile set BlockElementProfile = new ElementProfile BlockElementProfile.elementMetatype = "ODA Function Block"
' begin level 1 oda function block element profile, nested relation profile dim ODAFunctionBlockNested set ODAFunctionBlockNested = new RelationProfile ODAFunctionBlockNested.nestingType = "Nested"
BlockElementProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, ODAFunctionBlockNested ' end level 1 oda function block element profile, nested relation profile level1.elementProfiles.Add 1, BlockElementProfile
' end level 1 oda function block element profile
levelList.Add 1, level1 ' begin level 2 Independent component set level2 = new hierarchylevel
level2.numobjects = 7 level2.flowdirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION level2.objectHeight = 90 level2.objectWidth = 250 level2.horizOffset = 30 level2.horizSpace = 10 level2.vertOffset = 50 level2.vertSpace = 10 level2.objectstyle.fillcolor = colorWhite level2.objectstyle.fontname = "Arial" level2.objectstyle.fontsize = 12
' begin level 2 Independent Component element profile dim IndependentComponentElementProfile set IndependentComponentElementProfile = new ElementProfile IndependentComponentElementProfile.elementMetatype = "Impl. Independent Component"
' begin level 2 Indpendent Component element profile, nested profile dim IndependentComponentNested set IndependentComponentNested = new RelationProfile IndependentComponentNested.nestingType = "Nested"
IndependentComponentElementProfile.relationProfiles.Add 1, IndependentComponentNested ' end level 2 Indpendent Component element profile, nested profile
' begin level 2 Indpendent Component element profile, related profile dim IndependentComponentRelated set IndependentComponentRelated = new RelationProfile IndependentComponentRelated.nestingType = "Related" IndependentComponentRelated.relationType = "Aggregation" IndependentComponentRelated.relationStereotype = "TMF_BlockContainsComponent" IndependentComponentRelated.relatedType = "Class" IndependentComponentRelated.relatedStereotype = "TMF_IIC"
IndependentComponentElementProfile.relationProfiles.Add 2, IndependentComponentRelated ' end level 2 Indpendent Component element profile, related profile
level2.elementProfiles.Add 1, IndependentComponentNested ' end level 2 Independent Componen
levellist.add 2, level2
' *** 3rd LEVEL *** NOT active set level3 = New HierarchyLevel
level3.numObjects = 3 level3.flowDirection = TOP_DOWN_FLOW_DIRECTION
level3.elementMetatype = "Aggregated Function" level3.objectHeight = 70 level3.objectWidth = 200 level3.horizOffset = 30 level3.horizSpace = 3 level3.vertOffset = 70 level3.vertSpace = 3 'level3.nestingType = "nested"
level3.objectStyle.fillColor = colorWhite 'level3.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level3.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level3.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level3.objectStyle.fontSize = 9 'level3.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
'levelList.Add 3, level3
' *** FOURTH LEVEL *** *** NOT active set level4 = New HierarchyLevel
level4.numObjects = 3 level4.flowDirection = LEFT_RIGHT_FLOW_DIRECTION
level4.elementMetatype = "Function" level4.objectHeight = 45 level4.objectWidth = 180 level4.horizOffset = 25 level4.horizSpace = 3 level4.vertOffset = 60 level4.vertSpace = 3
'level4.nestingType = "Related" 'level4.relationType = "Aggregation" 'level4.relationStereotype = "TMF_AFAggregatesFunction" 'level4.relatedType = "Class" 'level4.relatedStereotype = "TMF_Function"
level4.objectStyle.fillColor = colorLightSkyBlue 'level4.objectStyle.lineWidth = 1 'level4.objectStyle.lineColor = colorBlack level4.objectStyle.fontName = "Arial" level4.objectStyle.fontSize = 8 'level4.objectStyle.fontColor = colorBlack
' levelList.Add 4, level4
set getDiagramLevelList = levelList
end function

sub OnProjectBrowserScript()
dim treeSelectedType dim package as EA.Package dim levelList ' as Dictionary(Of HierarchyLevel) dim element as EA.Element
treeSelectedType = Repository.GetTreeSelectedItemType() Session.Output "starting AF" select case treeSelectedType case otPackage Session.Output "package selected" set package = Repository.GetTreeSelectedObject() Session.Output "found " + cstr(package.Elements.Count) + " elements!" set levelList = getDiagramLevelList for each element in package.Elements Session.Output "element type " + element.MetaType + " found!" if element.MetaType = "Aggregated Function" then createNestedHierarchyDiagram element, levelList, "custom", false end if next case else Session.Prompt "This script supports Aggregated Functions in Packages.", promptOK end select Session.Output "done" end sub
